Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rand R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here one night before going on a cruise. We arrived at 3:00PM; which was listed as check in time. Another couple arrived at the same time. The manager went up to check the rooms for readiness. In the mean time the clerk issued us keys for a room. Upon arrival, the room was not ready, but the manager waived us down the hall to another room and told us that he would bring new key cards up in a few minutes. Before he got back, the other couple used their keys to let themselves into our room. They went back down to find out what was going on, we never saw them again. The room was clean, moderately sized and well equipped. The staff friendly and attempted to be helpful, but a broken printer at checkout and lack of communication with the cleaning staff made things more difficult than necessary. It was a $15+ (cash) each way taxi ride to everywhere we wanted to go to in the city. There was no good way to walk to any attractions or the beach. The taxi rides got to be more expensive and used more cash than we had anticipated. The Bistro 66 attached to the hotel served a very good breakfast and had excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “A great European Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jim G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while she was competing in the 70.3 Ironman San Juan. This is a European style hotel, right down to the bistro off the lobby (which by the way serves excellent food). The staff was more than helpful when it came to storing the wife's bike, providing information and ... just being friendly. Our room was clean and comfortable (it was next to the ice machine, but after a day it was not an issue). If you are looking for a Marriott type hotel, don't go here, but if you want a neighborhood locale and a boutique style experience where the staff recognizes you when you come "home", this is it. Grocery store down the block, a Condado Lagoon beach just down the block (no pool) and local restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Trip with my college friends”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca W
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went here for our spring break last week and we had an amazing time. We were on a budget, so we didn't expect much from this place- and were pleasantly surprised. We spent a lot of time on their roof deck (eating various meals- or in between activities). The staff is all very helpful and kind- and gave us really great recommendations for places to eat, or go out at night. It isn't a luxurious resort but it is clean, well kept, and really close to everything we wanted to do. It only costs $16 plus $1 per bag to get a taxi to the airport. The only problem we had was that the hot water ran out fairly quickly- but since it was hot anyways none of us found this to be a really big issue. I would really recommend this place- I think that you get a ton of value for what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Hummmm...It's OK, if you're not expecting luxury.”
Reviews.Author: joloughlin
Reviews.Content: After our cruise we opted for a 1-day lay-over to see Old Town San Juan. From Hotel Miramar, 10 minutes by city bus (50 cents per/person 1-way), will get you to Old Town SJ. --Hotel Miramar is an old hotel. My main objection was with the bathroom; it did not have an exhaust fan. Thus, mold / mildew was built up on the ceiling over the shower. The proprietor tried to paint over it, but you can't get rid of mold with paint. We tried opening the bathroom window to vent the shower steam, but the outside air was just as humid as the inside. Also, the bed sheets were scratchy, cigarette burns in the bedspread, and the pillows were hard as a sack of potatoes. With that said -- if you stay here just know that you are not staying at a plush hotel...it's just a place to spend the night. The hotel was mostly clean, conveniently located with several restaurants within walking distance, and it was quiet; no street noise. The manager was very helpful, friendly, and accommodating. We dropped our bags off at 9am, returned at 2pm and our bags were waiting for us in the room. I had difficulty rating this hotel -- if you just need a convenient place to sleep...you'll like it. If you are accustomed to luxury...you may want to keep looking. ---- p.s., I have photos, but they are no different than the ones already posted. I have a pic of the mold if you want to see that.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Unprofessional & Delinquents!”
Reviews.Author: Locg22
Reviews.Content: I rented two rooms in advance! During my stay at the valet parking the attendant crashed my car causing damaged to it! I reported the incident! I ended up receiving on partial payment for the damaged after a year and half of the date of the incident! After numerous calls finally the owner, Mr. Sanchez responded in an unprofessional and unethical manner. I wouldn't recommend anyone to stay here, EVER! Mr. Sanchez as well as his staff are the equivalent of functional DELINQUENTS!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!! THEY ARE CROOKS!!”
Reviews.Author: chevygal99
Reviews.Content: Well, after reading the review that was last posted, I feel exactly how that other person feels. I too had a reservation for Feb 25, but due to airline delays, I was unable my connection to San Juan. I called this hotel to let them know I will not be arriving, and was told it was non refundable. I had called and emailed many, many times asking for a confirmation. I never once received an email and was never told what the cancellation policy was. After being told that my nights room was non refundable, I told them that I will be needing a room the following Sunday after our cruise and asked if they could use those funds. I was told that I would need to speak to a manager. I never heard back. I called and emailed several times and never got a response other than it is non refundable. They were very rude about it and not willing to take responibility for not informing me of their cancellation policy or emailing me the requested information that I asked for several times. I did not book my reservation on their website, I called the hotel direct. I would have thought they would have told me the policy regardless of how I booked. I work for a major airline and interact with thousands of people a week who are travelling. I have a travel blog and many people are referred to me because of my extensive travel background. I go on cruises every 3 months and make a lot of recommendations. I WILL NEVER RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE. I advised them of this and they said 'they could care less.' Bad customer service travels faster than good and apparently they don't realize this. But, after reading the previous review, they are rolling in the money and turning people away. I dont understand how this hotel is staying in business. I have also filed a complaint with the Better Business Bureau. This is absolutely unacceptable. By the way, I ended up paing 3 times the amount to stay at another hotel the following Sunday. I didn't care how much it cost, as long as the Hotel Miramar doesn't get another dime of my money. I will make sure to let everyone know, and I am sure they wont care either.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: JJLMT
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at the Miramar for February 25, 2012, in April of 2011, for a 1 night stay before our cruise. We had 4 rooms booked for our family. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted outside by a baggage boy holding envelopes (5 to be exact) and 1 with our name on it. He told us "sorry, but we are booked full and you will have to stay at our sister hotel around the corner". When I told him that was unacceptable and I wanted to speak to the manager he told me "the manager is gone for the day and won't be available until 7am tomorrow morning." I went into the lobby and went to the desk to voice my discontent. How can a hotel overbook when our rooms were booked almost a year ago, and if they overbooked the rooms 10 months ago, why weren't we notified so we could have made alternative arrangements? After 10 minutes of insisting I wasn't going anywhere until I spoke to someone in management, low and behold, they hotel manager appeared. Her name was Lourdes. We attempted to show her our confirmation papers on our rooms and explained we did NOT want to stay at the shabby looking hotel around the corner. She told us to bad, but the rooms were all booked and we could not stay there. When we tried to reason with her that we booked 10 months in advance, she just smirked and said "oh well, contact Expedia and let them help you." She was rude to say the least, and not one bit willing to listen to us, or even look at the reservation papers I had. We paid in advance when we booked so our rooms were already paid for back in April of 2011. When we asked her if the supposed sister hotel she was pawning us off on was comparable with the Miramar she would not answer us. They never offered to show us the room in advance so we could determine if we wanted to stay there. With 9 family members standing outside in the street with luggage, we were forced to walk down the street and up a hill, carrying our own luggage of course to this "sister" hotel. My elderly mother who has trouble walking was with us, and after traveling the entire day from NY I wasn’t about to search the phone book for hotels in San Juan, and pay yet again for 4 rooms. We walked to the Olympus Hotel around the corner. It wasn't the slightest comparable to the Miramar. It was a hotel straight out of the 1960's. The rooms were nothing like the rooms we booked at the Miramar. Also upon looking at the price guide on the back of the room door, they were also a lot cheaper. The only compensation Lourdes was willing to offer was a continental breakfast (which by the way should have come with our room anyway had we been guests at the Miramar). The Olympus (sister hotel) had NO amenities at all to offer. The hallways and the rooms had a VERY strong smell of bleach, which right off the bat made me wonder what might be crawling around the rooms, or the bed. Needless to say this has been the worst customer service I have ever received. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone based on the scam they are running. I say scam because I believe that is exactly what they are doing. Overbooking the hotel rooms at the Miramar, taking the people who may have paid a higher price on the rooms, allowing them to stay, and then shifting the people who didn't pay as much to the "sister" hotel around the corner where the prices are cheaper. Meanwhile, the Miramar has been paid up front for the room and is making money by throwing you a lower priced hotel, and throwing business to the Olympus. The staff was at least friendly to us at the Olympus. The staff at the Miramar seemed to be scared of Lourdes and not willing to answer questions when she was around. Shame on you Miramar for making our stay in San Juan such an unpleasant experience. If this is the way that you treat customers, it’s a wonder anyone wants to stay at your hotel at all. I will make sure all of the cruise boards I am on know about this so this experience doesn’t happen to them. My pre cruise stay in Puerto Rico was less than pleasant thanks to the Miramar. John, Syracuse NY

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: BhaviniA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Miramar for 3 nights. The staff is courteous and very helpful, they gave us good recommendations on local joints to eat, tours to take and where to find convenient and cheap parking in Old San Juan. The rooms could use a little updating but they are clean and adequate. We had a king size bed, microwave, fridge, hair dryer(much needed :) ) and iron. The neighborhood seemed safe with pharmacy, grocery and restaurants within a block and 10 mins drive to Old San Juan. The hotel is on a one way street for cars so we had to go around few blocks to get to it, got a little tricky the first couple of times but it shouldn't be a problem if you don't have a car. They offer free parking which was a plus.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: SMP272
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Miramar for 1 night after a cruise. I have to say that many of the reviews I read about the hotel after booking it on Hotwire were spot on from the rooms to the water issues. This hotel is conveniently located in an area of the city that has numerous eating establishments so we really had no problem finding anything to eat. The room was clean and comfortable and we had free wifi (which is always a plus). When we arrived the room we had reserved was not ready, but we were quickly given another ready room by the manager. He also remembered my name the next day, which is a plus - I felt at home. Also, I called ahead to the hotel to find out about the cost of a taxi ride to the hotel and a new staff person was able to give me info and direction about going to the taxi stand at the airport and they would give me a price for the ride before I got in the taxi. The only things I had issue with were the earlier morning knocks on the door by housekeeping, which I couldn't understand since checkout wasn't until 12pm. Also, it was quiet at night but the room door does not block out a lot of noise so I heard the housekeeping staff in the hallway in the morning. Also each room has its own water heater for the hot water. So we ran out of hot water after some time. I would definitely stay at this hotel again when I go to SanJuan.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pat T
Reviews.Content: I had written this when we were there but isn't showing up. We stayed at the Hotel Miramar for two days before a cruise and one after. We would stay there again in a heartbeat. The hotel is small, old fashioned but in all the right ways. Spotlessly clean with incredible staff. Noelia, Silvia, Jill all did their very best to help us. Sent us to great local spots, including the Castilla Miramar, an incredible restaurant. The hotel is in a very convenient neighborhood, with a pharmacy, grocery, organic deli and movie theater within a block. And it is on a major bus line, so for fifty cents we could go wherever we wanted. The staff gave us great directions, recommendations and service. I have seldom seen a staff as helpful and friendly in my years of travel.

Reviews.Title: “Manager Ms.Silvia personally take care”
Reviews.Author: Salim M
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this property for last one year pleasant, clean and friendly. I alway recommend all my friends, family and business travellers to stay since I get the best hospitally and it's also centrally located. I have to personally thanks Ms.Silvia Manager of the property she is an excellent person and most helpful all manner. I alway call her for my booking and she take care of it seamlessly. And it's wonderful to know person who knows you in person which it homely.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best value”
Reviews.Author: eriu31
Reviews.Content: First off, you will be landing in a shady looking neighborhood. There is no obvious way to reach the hotel unless you drive against traffic or use the bus lane. I booked a king bed room through hotels.com. When I arrived, two hours after check-in time, it was not ready. I sat around in the lobby for a bit. When I got it, I was surprised to find I got a two full beds room. I called front desk about it, to no avail. Since I had booked online, I had no claim. The girl at the front desk asked me to bring a copy of my reservation so she could read it to me. Surely enough, this was an additional humilliation I did not want, so I sucked it up and asked for nothing else. If you are staying here, know there is no parking for your car, no hot water in your faucet, no coffemaker; and although there is a microwave and a small fridge you will not find mugs, plates or even a spoon, so bring your own. There are a lot of nice places to eat within walking distance. Be careful if walking around late, there is quite a few unoccupied buildings around the block.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, easy access to Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Brasstess
Reviews.Content: The neighbourhood might not be to everyone's liking, but this is the place to stay. Very clean, very quiet and extraordinary people to welcome you. The hotel has a 'bistro', but you will also find restaurants nearby. Our room had a small fridge and microwave and there is a grocery store within walking distance. The bus stops in front of the hotel and for 50 cents it will get you the Old San Juan terminal where you can catch the free trolley. We stayed for 2 nights before cruising

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JPWONG
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel countless times in the past for business reasons, and it has never occured to me that I should properly write a review about my experience. I guess because most of my previous visits only spent a night or so at the hotel. Anyway, this time around, I did stay for 3 nights, so... The staffs are very friendly and accommodating. Since I do not personally speak Spanish, they are willing to teach me a few words for me to get by. Great location, about 10 to 15 minutes away from Old San Juan. The bus stop is just a block away. A few restaurants and a supermarket (if you need grocery for an extended stay) are just up the block. The room is clean and roomy with microwave and refrigerator. I especially love the rooftop terrace. It offers a great view of the city and plenty of fresh air. The only concern seems to be the water in the shower. A few times, the water did not come out hot enough, well...it was not exactly cold, but I guess given the warm weather in PR, it shouldn't be much a problem. A great value for the overall experience and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for San Juan”
Reviews.Author: RustyCarpenter
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor, read the previous reviews, and then booked it. It was an excellent choice. It is about a 10-minute bus or taxi ride to old San Juan and is in a nice business and residential mix neighborhood. The staff was very friendly and there is a restaurant attached to the hotel, and several others in the neighborhood. There also is a movie complex just up the block with first run films. Our room was large and very comfortable. Our only concern was a certain mustiness upon entering the room. We suspected the air conditioner filter needed to be changed. A couple of other guests that we talked to also noticed the odor. Overall, a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value and service!”
Reviews.Author: SEGMN
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night after spending over a week on the East side of the island. I scored a great deal on hotwire and just needed a clean place to sleep. The hotel is a boutique-style hotel in Miramar, a residential area, which is about a 10 minute walk to Condado area. Hotel Miramar was absolutely perfect for what I needed! The public bus stop was right across the street and for .50, I took the M3 bus to Old San Juan where I spent the entire day walking and exploring. The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful with questions about Old San Juan, nearby dining, taxis, safety, etc.. The hotel is SO charming, there is a little sitting area on the lobby floor but away from the lobby area with computers for guests' use. There is a fitness center, laundry facilities and a very nice rooftop terrace offering sweeping views of the city. The rooms were very spacious and incredibly clean. This was the perfect simple accommodation for one night. My only complaints were that the water in my shower never got hot, only lukewarm and the bed was a little hard for me. Nevertheless, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting!”
Reviews.Author: believer4ever
Reviews.Content: Others have told you many things, so I won't go into those repeated things. When you pull up to the hotle, you may think you have made a mistake... it looks like an unsafe neighborhood. I do not know if that is true or not, but we had no problems. The hotel room ws clean, the bed comfortable, and the bathroom was like visiting an aunt's house... green tile, pedistal sink, and bath tub with shower. Two windows in our room, and a king size bed. Nice air conditioning, and an elevator. The roof top deck was g-r-e-a-t!! The night time views were spectacular. We were there during the St. Sabastian festival, so it was crowded. I was not impressed with the knowledge of the staff... they told us that we could take a bus to Old San Juan. We waited, and finally a taxi took us there for a very nominal fee. When it was time to return to the hotel, the buses were not running where they had told us. The streets were so crowded that no taxi could get through. We had to walk the 2.5 miles back to the hotel. The directions we were given to find our way back were " keep the water to your right arm, and you will find us". We did find our way back, but it was late, and we had some giant blisters on our feet that took all week to heal. The streets are narrow, and bumpy, and sidewalks are nonexistent.... or the cars are parked on them... and the people walk along side the curb. The traffic was backed up so far the next morning, that we had to go to the corner and wait to flag a taxi... the hotel could not call one because the taxi could not get into the one way street. The small bistro next door is nice. Their coffee is good, but americans beware.... there is no bottomless cups in San Juan!! All in all, the hotel is nice, clean, and will do.... but it was expensive for what we got, and it's location. A suggestion to the management.... have more than one employee at the front desk in the morning... that poor girl was s-w-a-m-p-e-d!!! and, we all had to wait in a crowded lobby.

Reviews.Title: “great place to start or end a cruise”
Reviews.Author: thalpin
Reviews.Content: very clean, good value,very helpful staff,take the bus to Old San Juan!!!50cents!be sure to take a day to visit the rainforest!!Carlos is a great guide!!TEHALPIN

Reviews.Title: “Nice, large room”
Reviews.Author: annie8848
Reviews.Content: Nice, large room, a little dated in design but not bad.Clean. Fridge, microwave.Bed was a little firm for me. Located down the street in walking distance from restaurants and supermarket. We ate at Lima restaurant, very good though slow service. Stayed one night before cruise and it was quite acceptable. 16. dollar taxi ride from the airport.Can catch a bus across the street -.50 cents per person-and ride to bus terminal to old town San Juan. Then take free shuttle that goes around all of old town--get off and on at many points. We had ocean view from our room #401 and close to cruise terminal. I think it was a 6 dollar taxi to cruise ship. Xmas through Jan 14th there is the Festival of San Sebastian--streets close in the afternoon and shuttles stop running. not far to walk though back to bus terminal.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stop”
Reviews.Author: Roseanne A
Reviews.Content: We were visiting a friend on the west side of the island and needed a quiet place just outside San Juan for one night, as it was a festival day. We selected the Hotel Miramar from the tourist map without any other knowledge of the place and were delighted to find a clean, updated, fresh facility with a delightfully helpful concierge, Sylivia, who did everything in her power to make our stay pleasant. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “"Family Fun"”
Reviews.Author: Susan B
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time in San Juan and stayed at the Hotel Miramar. It was very close to the airport. Bus stop near hotel took us into Old San Juan and staff was very helpful in giving us ideas for daytrips and good local restaurants (some within walking distance) The hotel was very fresh, clean & updated with some spanish antiques and flair. We thought the rooms were very spacious and our toddler was very comfortable. We thought this hotel had the best rates in town!!! Cute restaurant downstairs served us a quick breakfast in the morning and had a pleasant aura. We were a little dissapointment with the extremely laid back almost absent waiter during breakfast but we figured he was probably tired from working a night shift up the street. Had a great time & would recommend to friends and family !!!

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with friendly staff in quite area.”
Reviews.Author: iccc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located at the edge of a residential area, near a shopping street and in walking distance from the convention centre. The rooms are quite, have free internet access. The hotel staff is very friendly. Breakfast is served in a small room, a la carte; it is cheap and of reasonable quality.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: TTbarrie
Reviews.Content: Not only is this Hotel in a sketchy neighborhood but their attitude is terrible. After I booked an ocean view ( overtop of some rundown buildings ) room that the manger said had a pullout couch I was told that my young daughter couldn't sleep on it. I was forced late at night to rent a 2nd room ! Just to make things ridiculous the clerk told me he just spoke to the MGR and the MGR wanted to make sure that we wouldn't have 5 people in the room !!! This after we just paid for a 2nd room !!! can you imagine leaving the 2nd room empty after just paying a stupid last minute rate for it. Had he been up front I could have booked 2 cheaper rooms instead of the room with the pullout couch ( chair) When leaving it took us half an hour to get the 1 slow elevator they have and then after waiting with 20 other people in their small lobby to check out we ended up just leaving. Book anywhere else in SAN JUAN

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarinaLB
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 nights at the Miramar Hotel. We had no clue whether it would be good or not but we really enjoyed staying there. The staff were wonderful, very friendly and helpful. The room was good. It's an older building but has been updated. I would recommend this hotel as the place to stay in San Juan. Wonderful view of the ocean and lagoon from our room. Breakfast at the hotel was great. Service wonderful. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: roamingirishman
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed here recently pre cruise and found everything just fine.very efficient staff at check in and out.lovely clean marbled floor bedroom no complaints.had a few reasonably priced drinks at the bar on site.friendly local people made chat with us which we enjoyed.breakfast next morning was very fresh and tasty and reasonably priced.the only complaint i have about san juan is that the taxis are a complete rip off which i think should be regulated a bit better,but other than that everything was good and i would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre Cruise Location for budget minded”
Reviews.Author: Lazier
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel for a day in San Juan prior to a cruise. Most were sold out that had reasonable locations to the cruise terminal. We also like to check out small boutique hotels when visiting locations. After some searching we found Hotel Miramar. We made a reservation for a room called "run of the house" for $99. This means you get what is available when you arrive. We were lucky enough to get a room with a king size bed, close to elevator, and the room was clean. Upon our arrival which was a short $25 cab ride from the airport we met "Sylvia" who was extremely busy and pretty much overloaded, but she took care of us immediately even though we arrived before check in time. Sylvia as well as the rest of the staff we met were very pleasant and helpful. The great parts of the hotel are its convenient location with a drug store, super market, and cafe within steps of the hotel. Want to go to Old San Juan ? Jump on the bus just outside the hotel. Cost 50 cents VS $20 cab ride. Clean and safe. There is a laundry in the hotel which we used so we had all clean clothes when we got to the ship. The roof top is pretty cool with a view of San Juan. Down side of the hotel is that it is dated, there was a slight odor in the room but I think it was just something they clean with. Again, bathrooms and room were clean and no sign of bugs ! big thing with my wife. Lastly there is a small cafe next to the hotel. We had lunch there and it was excellent !! awesome soup, great local beer, nice wine !

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean room, typical Puerto Rico service.”
Reviews.Author: peterjontheroadagain
Reviews.Content: Parking is a chore and not a great place to walk but is an easy bus or taxi ride to old town. Would stay again for a night or two (why would anyone want to spend more than two nights in PR anyway?). Did not try Bistro. Too bad the sun deck closes at 11.

Reviews.Title: “adequate”
Reviews.Author: farish2
Reviews.Content: We picked Hotel Miramar for the reasonable price and location - close to Old San Juan. It is an old property that has been partially updated. It was adequate in that we planned to spend most of our time away from our hotel rooms on excursions out of San Juan, and it was easy to catch the city bus for cheap transportation to sightsee in Old San Juan. The hotel is located in an older business section of San Juan. There are a few decent restaurants (Casita Miramar) close by and some fast food (Papa John's, Subway). As there are no coffee makers in the room, and the coffee from the small bar/restaurant in the hotel is $2.00/cup (no refills) and they don't want you to take it up to your room, Subway has the best coffee at a good price ($1.25). Sylvia, the manager, was very helpful! She responds promptly to emails and phone calls and offered prompt assistance with problems or questions.

Reviews.Title: “just NO”
Reviews.Author: singjoy
Reviews.Content: If all the travel web sites said breakfast is included why isn’t it when you ask for???? The manager said that complimentary or courtesy breakfast ended in January 2011. This was why I picked this particular hotel…. You can say no wireless internet because it was down all 4 day we stayed there. Travelocity and Orbitz both said Complimentary continental breakfast and free wireless internet just check it out for yourself before you go.

Reviews.Title: “High hopes......let down”
Reviews.Author: sunray712
Reviews.Content: visited Sept. 23 before a cruise booked to return for a couple of days after cruise. After staying one night, I cancelled before the ship left Puerto Rico. Our AC was not working well, desk person came up and AC got cooler. Small ants were in the bathroom and crawling on nightstand. I was bitten by one. No hot water from basin, just a very loud noise(Rm 301). The comforter fell off on the floor during the night exposing a nice size dirt smear on the sheet. Sheets and pillowcases were dingy. The bathroom was very nice. We visited several floors and sweated badly because the hallways were so hot. Received a call about 9AM from front desk telling us to close an open window because it was raining. No windows in our room were opened. A couple of nice stores down the street and a small restaurant but I would not return here. Nice view of the city on roof top. Free breakfast but very small bistro had about 3-4 tables to accomendate guest. I didn't even go down.

Reviews.Title: “One night at Miramar”
Reviews.Author: Sarah L
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience at Hotel Miramar. We stayed for only one night before we departed for our cruise. Check in was no problem, and the women working the front desk was very friendly and helpful giving us tips on nearby dining, and getting us down to Old San Juan. She recommended a VERY nice resturaunt that is a 2 minute walk, it had a castle theme/name (sorry can't remeber exactly) but it is the only one nearby. We had a wonderful dinner there, I highly recommend it$15-$22 per plate, but well worth it. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel that goes to Old San Juan ( a 5 min ride) for only 75 cents. There is some local shopping, and a grocery store as mentioned in other reviews right down the road in walking distance. The rooms were nice, clean, beds were fine. Bathrooms were nice with the tile work, my only complaint was that our shower drained slowly so my feet were in an inch of water when I was done. There is a roof top area that has a beautiful view of the city and water with lounge chairs and a table. It was very nice. On check out day we went to Old San Juan and we were able to leave our luggage at the hotel. I was concerned because of a review I read on here, but we had no issues at all with this, and I appreciate being able to do this so I could go see Old SJ...which you should do too, it's beautiful! Especially the forts which is only $3 per person to walk through. Amazing. Anyway, overall I felt like I certainly got my moneys worth, and I think Miramar is a lovely place with nice rooms and very helpful staff. If I ever make my way to Puerto Rico again, I would certainly stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was okay for our four day stay”
Reviews.Author: deeA2011
Reviews.Content: On the outside the hotel looks small. We got a double room which was spacious with a beautifully tiled bathroom. A refrigerator was a good accomodation because we were able to go to the Pueblo grocery store a few blocks down to get some fruits, juice and yogurt to reduce our dine-out bill. It was a little pricey but convenient. Our online room rate was honored, but they did not give us our discount. We believe it would be better to obtain any discounts directly with the hotels. We ended up spending about as much for our hotel as we would have booking at one of the nicer hotels in Condado a much nicer district. The hotel was conveniently located a few miles from the Old San Juan tourist district. The only other drawback was the smelly carpets which we sprayed with air freshener. My husband liked the nice decor inside. This was an average hotel with nice decor. We were pleased with the size of the room. Although parking was limited with our small car we were able to squeeze in the small lot in back of the hotel which accomodates 4 or 5 cars. Our online discount rate with taxes and fees was $288 for 3 nights we paid $327 instead. The rate was $86 per night but the tax and tariff was 21% and there was a $5 room surcharge per night.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: hjkroeze
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Puerto Rico we stayed in the Miramar Hotel not knowing what to expect. From entering the hotel untill leaving we had a great experience. The staff is very, very helpfull, the rooms are clean and great and the food in the Bistro 606 is excellent. If you rented a car you are in for a surprise, because there are only 3 parking places at the back of the hotel, but in the area around you always can find a free spot. And because we are not very demanding, it was no problem at all. The location is superb: just outside Old San Juan and the view from the sunroof is magnificent. We'll sure be staying there on our next trip to Puerto Rico. A great island with many inteersting things to see and visit.

Reviews.Title: “Just checked in- great”
Reviews.Author: DrJK12
Reviews.Content: When I first booked the hotel, I was worried about 1) service in general, 2)internet access and 3) parking after reading the reviews. Completely contradictory experience. Getting to the hotel: The GPS couldn't locate the address so it might be worthwhile to print out the directions to get in from the airport. 1) Checking in: Just an outstanding and charming welcome from Noelia. Chose the room for us to make sure we are comfortable. 2) Internet: No problems logging in from the room (currently logged on). 3) Parking: 3 spaces only but Noelia explained that we can leave the keys with her. I think this should be fine. I will provide the final note at checkout but looking forward to the next two days here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Excellent Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Laura_3148
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at Hotel Miramar! Stayed for a little over a week in the end of March beginning of April 2011. This is the perfect hotel for a short or long stay. Hotel staff was always friendly, and caring. Stayed with a group of 3 women ranging from 22-68. We always felt safe in the area. There is a bus stop almost in front of the hotel, a grocery store right up the block, and some great little places to catch a quick lunch or a nice dinner. Our room was in the front of the building so we had a beautiful view of the ocean. The roof top deck was the perfect place to spend time in the evening/night, and the rooms are HUGE compared to most hotels I have stayed in. I can't wait to get back and explore more of Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: docmo06
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay!!! Friendly staff, clean rooms, great price, and beautiful roof terrace. We loved it and we'll be back again....hopefully soon....PR is lovely!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Comfy and Clean as always”
Reviews.Author: msd30
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Hotel Miramar!! I really enjoy staying at this hotel!! When I'm there, I feel like I'm at a mini Ritz Carlton!! The service is great, the staff is friendly, the rooms are a nice size and more importantly very clean, the decoration is lovely, and the newly renovated bathrooms are gorgeous!! Even though there is not a pool, there is a fantastic roof top terrace, where you can sunbathe and relax with a beautiful view of the city and the sea!! I will definitely be staying a third time!!

Reviews.Title: “The MVP.....I mean MVH (most valuable hotel)”
Reviews.Author: elias p
Reviews.Content: This hotel in its category of small hotels is a giant in several aspects, great costumer service, great atmosphere, the staff treats you like family, the rooms are very spacious, and comfortable beds help you rest after a long day of sight seeing. The hotel has a nice roof terrace, that in our case (girlfriend and I), brought a very romantic moment with a spectacular view of the stars and the city lights. We can't wait to be back!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel and we will be back, we felt like home”
Reviews.Author: plostaunau
Reviews.Content: We enjoy the hospitality of the hotel. We had a very spacious room and a great restaurant. The people was very friendly and helpful with us. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Never Judge a Hotel by its' size”
Reviews.Author: Rudy C
Reviews.Content: Just recently i traveled to San Juan on a business trip, but was a little disappointed because I could not get a reservation at the hotel i normally stay in. However, I have to recognize that size and fame aren't always best. From the moment I arrived at the Miramar Hotel with the warmest personal touch, a smile that one could feel was genuine and sincere. Rooms though not very large are adequate but very clean and service was more than i expected. But have to give a special thanks to the front desk personnel for all the help they provided me during my 4 days there! Though smaller than most in size, TheMiramar Hotel is certainly larger than most in servitud and equal in quality. I'll never again judge a hotel by its' size!

Reviews.Title: “Bad, bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Jan K
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately my experience with Hotel Miramar has been very bad. Here are the main reasons: * their wireless internet is a joke. The signal came from a crappy wireless modem attached to the hallway wall just outside one of the guestrooms. I know that because it went down on my second day there and the hotel management didn't do anything about for the next two and a half days (needless to say, I really needed the connection). * the AC in my room was really noisy (I checked and the same type of AC's were in other rooms as well). It was actually so noisy that it would wake me up during nighttime. And you do need your AC turned on in PR. * even noisier was the ice making machine that I had on my floor. I might have been unlucky to be on the floor with the ice making machine, but that means that all other ten rooms on the floor were affected. And boy, that was one noisy ice making machine! * one of the reasons I chose this hotel was that the breakfasts were apparently included in the room price. Not true. They actually give you these coupons which give you $2.5 discount off the regular prices, which are really inflated e.g. they charged $7 for basic scrambled eggs which is A LOT by PR standards * talking about the kitchen / "restaurant", the guy taking orders was quite rude and low class, behaved like he wanted to punch anybody around him at any time... but hey - you get what you pay for...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location for exploring San Juan”
Reviews.Author: BruinPlayer
Reviews.Content: With a bus stop practically outside the front door, we could be in Old San Juan in 5 minutes or Isle Verde in 15. Playita Condado is a lovely 12-minute walk away, and was virtually deserted after sunset. Five minutes from Isle Grande airport for the trip to Calebra. Several restaurants and bars close by. A 24-hour grocery one block away made the in-room fridge and microwave a money-saver on our food bill. Wonderful views from the rooftop patio (which we had all to ourselves every night). All staff consistently hepful, friendly, and efficient. Very comfortable room/bed. We weren't in San Juan to hang out in a hotel, but wanted to be out and about, and Miramar was perfect for us. (And, if the elevator seems too slow for your hurried pace, you can do one of two things: slow down yourself, or take the stairs.)

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jewel”
Reviews.Author: SFtraveler6688
Reviews.Content: The room and other areas in this hotel is always clean. Everyone is cheerful, polite and extremely helpful. I have traveled around world but Miramar exceeded my expectation in every aspect. Free parking and wireless internet. Bus top to Old Town San Juan is a couple of min walking distance. This place is less than half miles away from Puerto Rico Convention Center. Love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay here”
Reviews.Author: PhilliTraveller007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the July 4th weekend. We stayed in a room which had a king size bed. Our room had a microwave, minifridge, TV, AC, Iron and Iron Board, hair drier, safe deposit, wireless internet. it seems microwave and minifridge are standard in all rooms. Not sure about other items. Usage of internet and safe deposit box was free which i liked since some hotels charge for such facility. The rooms and bathrooms were very well maintained. Every time we were back at the end of the day, our bed would be nicely done and all towels and bath soaps replaced and all thrash removed. We stayed there for 6 nights and each day they were very consistent in their maintenance. There are also laundry facilities for the guests. They provide room service for food. There are vending machines for water and Ice on I think alternate floors. The hotel also has a wonderful rooftop deck. The only shortage is parking but you always find some spot to park around the hotel. If you don't find a spot just park the car in their aisle and leave the key at the reception. They would park your car legally when there is parking space available around the hotel. Next day morning just pick the keys and they would tell you where they have parked your car around the hotel. the entire 6 days we did not have any parking problems. The front desk guys are very helpful and the front desk is manned 24 hrs. There is a Bistro on the ground floor of the hotel which was very convenient since every day morning we had our breakfast there. It opens at 7.00 am everyday except on Saturday/Sunday when it opens at 8.00 am. It has a bar. They also serve lunch and dinner, although we never tried it out. The location is just perfect. It is close to old city and if you want to go east towards Fajardo, Rt26 is right next to the hotel.The road access to this hotel is a little complex, but once you get used to it, its pretty simple. There is also a PUEBLO grocery store just walking distance from this place which was very convenient. Overall I am very much satisfied with my stay in Hotel Miramar and I would recommend it to fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Bflood2000
Reviews.Content: Went to San Juan for our honeymoon in June 2011. Was booked into Miramar hotel with the travel package so I dint know that much about it before hand. Let me state here I was very impressed. The staff led by manager Sylvia was very helpful. Always giving us directions and advise as we had rented a car. This hotel is not in the tourist zone but in the real city. The Miramar was clean, quiet and felt safe, it is close to beach. Parking is tight as it is in any large city. The roof top view patio view was spectacular. We took are dinner up there one evening. All in all I was very happy with the Miramar. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “VERY UNSUPPORTIVE STAFF IN TIMES OF MISFORTUNE"”
Reviews.Author: jrodroguez
Reviews.Content: The first 2 days were pleasant. However, on the 3rd day my rental car was vandalized at the hotel's valet parking, which consists of 4 spaces. Once the 4 spaces are filled the use the street parking as valet parking. If this type of experience isn't disturbing enough, to say the least, the hotel staff's lack of concern, empathy and courtesy was very disheartening. They had the key to the car but didnot move the car to another location. The windows were broken but the did not want to move the car and rather it stay on the street where it was vulnerable to further vandalism. The hotel is in a very dangerous neighborhood!!!

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem with Suberb Staff”
Reviews.Author: GrammyOntario
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very quaint, not too big, with a great view of the harbour from the attractive roof patio. Rooms are clean and very comfortable. Hotel is in the process of remodeling all bathrooms. Very close to the port, if you are cruising, with local bus (50 cents) right outside front door to old San Juan. The staff (Sylvia) are extremely friendly and all are most accommodating. Surrounding area, although looks a bit rough, has good restaurants and grocery shopping..."area is safe". Small restaurant and bar on property...breakfast, all we ate, excellent. Not a lot of frills but offers great value with very comfortable accommodation. No hesitation to recommend this hotel...we will be staying there the next time we go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: SMLBARB
Reviews.Content: We spent one pre-cruise night here and it was fine for that. The hotel does need updating, but it was clean and very convenient. We took the local bus to Old San Juan and walked to Condado Beach. The view from the rooftop was lovely day and night. We didn't have breakfast here - we stopped at a little cafe a half block away for a good and inexpensive breakfast. There is a grocery and pharmacies nearby so you can pick up wine and anything else you might need before your cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SanJuan-2011
Reviews.Content: Fine place of hotel. Close to the lagoon, Close to busstop - 5 minutes to Old San Juan (only 50 cents.) Nice sunterresse at the top of the hotel. Fine romms with good beds. Very helpfull frontdesk.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent service, and don't miss the rooftop terrace!”
Reviews.Author: Travel30066
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights and really enjoyed it. The rooms were somewhat outdated (nothing special), but did have a refrigerator, microwave, and free Wi-Fi. We had a great view of the Condado Bay and skyline from our room and an even better one from the beautiful rooftop terrace. This hotel is walking distance from Condado and a 75 cent bus ride to Old San Juan. We enjoyed being just outside the tourist area, because we could walk to a grocery store and a couple of nice cafes serving Puerto Rican food at reasonable prices. The hotel's free breakfast is just a basket of bread and small pastries, but you can apply your voucher for $2.50 off any other breakfast they serve, making it the cheapest breakfast (and quite good) in the area. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially Sylvia who allowed us to store a suitcase there for a few days while we went to Vieques. This place had a very local, friendly feel. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is clean, comfortable and has the best view of San Juan from roof terrace.”
Reviews.Author: ramos929
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to stay in San Juan with comfortable beds and nice bedrooms stay at hotel Miramar. The service is great and you need that to enjoy yourselves when you leave to learn about all the history that surrounds you. If you like to exercise it has a fitness room for you as well. You cant go wrong staying at this beautiful hotel, definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommeded if you are not the beach resort type”
Reviews.Author: PhilWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Things we liked about this hotel and its location include: - Perfect weather (72 to 82 every day during our 5 day January vacation) - Reasonable rates -Comfortable, clean, quiet room with a refrigerator and microwave - Free parking although mostly the hotel staff parked the car in the street - 10 minute, 50 cent bus ride to Old San Juan a few feet from the hotel - A nearby grocery store and several good restaurants including the one in the hotel - A rooftop patio where you can relax and view the ocean (plus smoke if you like) Any complaints have more to do with the neigborhood or San Juan in general than the hotel: Many of the nearby properties appear abandoned or neglected and several nearby restaurants that are listed on the internet simply do not exist. In addition the hotel is near a nexus of several high speed roads an overpasses which hinder walking in several directions. For example there is a Sizzler steakhouse overlooking a nearby yacht club within a few hundred yards of the hotel but it took me three days to figure out how to walk there without risking suicide by crossing the highways. Finally, virtually every private home in the area is surrounded by a razor or barbed wire topped wall or fence so crime must be a big problem. (PR has a hundred murders a month out of a population of 4 million. and private security guards and police are everwhere.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Expirience”
Reviews.Author: aestevez21
Reviews.Content: Looove, Loooved the Hotel. Small but cozy. The bathrooms are newlly renovated and spacious. The hotel has a warm, home feeling. Even though it does not have a pool, it has a big terrace at the top of the hotel with a great view of the surroundings and laggon. Here they have functions and parties. We were lucky to enjoy a function while we were ther Great location as well. Is in the middle of San Juan with in minutes of the "old san juan". The satff was very frindlly and since is a small hotel, they were able to deliver fast and accurate service. The sapce was very, very clean. Also, great restaurants within the block as well as in the Hotel. The owner, Juan, is friendlly and wants you to have a great experiance in Puerto Rico and offers great recommendations of sites to see, food and night life. We had a great time. Will recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Safe yourself go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: dvjx102
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in real big need of updating, the hotel the lobby is the only updated area the bathroom stop in 1970, not very well cleaned rooms ,the ice machine way down the hall can be heard a mile away,the continental breakfast is a joke, front desk well lets just say don't drop a $20.00 bill, it will never be seen again the folks there will make sure of that. the neighborhood it's alright, in the day bring lots a change, you will need it to give to the many poor unfortunate people as you walk down the street ,at night dont bother going out for a walk unless your looking for trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Sylvia is GREAT!!”
Reviews.Author: steveboces1
Reviews.Content: As many have said, the hotel is a good value. It is also located very close to the bus which takes you quickly to the Old City. The rooms could use some updating and there is some noise. Given the climate, a pool would have been nice. Having said all of this, Sylvia at the desk was a gem and made the hotel worthwhile. She was always cheery and helpful and sent us to 2 fabulous restaurants. (I'm a foodie so I'm very picky.) We liked her and the location enough, so that when we finished our sailing trip, we came back to the hotel for our last night in town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ada33178
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Miramar for 5 nights, I have travelled well and to many hotels world wide. This is a family run hotel similar to the small hotels you find in Europe. The room had a microwave and small fridge, ironing board and iron. The room and bathroom were very clean, good ambiance, excellent staff, more than a continental breakfast with hot oatmeal, pastrys, local bread, cereals, fruits. Good for cruise travelers or bussiness travelers, close but not walking distance to Condado, Old San Juan or metropolitan area. Helpful bilingual staff will get you a taxi to these areas. There is nothing near to walk at night, it is a quiet hotel. Would happily stay again and reccommend to friends. I saw many europeans staying there and many pre cruisers and they all had good comments.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value, Friendly and Knowledgable Staff”
Reviews.Author: phillip1941
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at this hotel prior to our cruise. We thoroughly enjoyed the stay. All the front desk personnel and dining room staff we had contact with were friendly, gave very helpful travel and sightseeing directions and recommended good eating places. They also drove me across town to help find a credit card I had left at a restaurant. Our room was very clean, pleasantly large, quiet and had a small microwave and fridge. The hotel is centrally located within 10 minutes walk of a beach, grocery store, pharmacy, and fast food places; 5 minute bus ride to Old San Juan and several galleries/museums; and with almost instant taxi service. The free continental breakfast was all you can eat and had more variety than often available. We ate once at the Bistro. The food was excellent and reasonably priced although a little slow in delivery. The hotel is a small independent business and to us that was part of its attraction. If you want big chain and luxury and 2 steps to the beach don't stay at the Miramar. If you want outstanding value for your dollar, helpful and friendly staff, and a convenient location then we recommend the hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Pre Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travellers807
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Miramar before our cruise in January. The rooms were spacious and very quiet at night. We enjoyed the sun deck immensely and found it very easy, inexpensive and quick to take the bus to Old San Juan. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again if we visited San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches”
Reviews.Author: Indy3110
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room for one night before our cruise. After checking in we inspected the mattresses for bed bugs. We didn't find any bed bugs but instead found a dead cockroach under one of the beds. We called the front desk and were offered to change rooms. When we expressed a concern that there may bugs in that room as well the managers got very agressive and we were told to leave the hotel immediately. He took a real offence that we inspected the beds for bed bugs. We asked if we could at least use the internet at the hotel to find ourselves another hotel, as it was late and dark outside and we didin't know the area. The manager refused. We were also told that we would be charged for the room if we left. We were worried that we may not find another hotel since this is a busy time of the year for cruise passenger so we elected to stay in a different room. Needless to say we didn't sleep much that night. We have never been treated so poorly in any hotel before and we travel a lot. The hotel is not in a great area and we didn't feel safe walking around at night.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Spruce
Reviews.Content: Our family is two adults and a 3-year old child. Let me just say because it's important, anyone who complains about the breakfast here has never had a continental breakfast before. We thought the food selection and quality were FABULOUS for a free hotel breakfast! And the coffee was excellent. Of course they won't let you pack a lunch from the continental breakfast - go buy your lunch in town. Duh. We stayed at the Miramar twice, one night before a cruise and three after. We therefore had two different rooms. They were both large and spotlessly clean, and both had a nice microwave and bar fridge. The first (406) had a king-sized bed against a wall with a window, which was odd but there was nowhere else to put it. The security light outside shone under the curtain all night which I thought would bother me but we all slept fine. The second room (304) had two double beds and looked onto the next-door hotel which is currently being gutted. I had no complaints about either room. The air conditioning worked well but the unit in the second room was much newer and quieter. When we checked in the second time, the elevator was broken. I thought "here we go" but a technician was called and it was fixed within half an hour. Some other hotels might have left it broken for days so this was impressive. The staff were pleasant. Somehow our booking was made for the wrong days but it was corrected without any hassle or really any investigation at all. To this day I have no idea whose mistake it was. The laundry worked well and was much cheaper than on our cruise. The rooftop is very nice. For us the best feature was the Pueblo supermarket a block away, and 3 pharmacies within walking distance. There are also some good restaurants around. There are two computers in the lobby which are free for patrons' use. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise hotel, great for the price, location”
Reviews.Author: mauiwahine
Reviews.Content: Cab cost $26 to Hotel Miramar for all 6 of us. There was a nice restaurant just around the corner but it was already closed since it was past 10pm. We later found out that another couple said they had a wonderful time at that restaurant the night before. We went down the street, within visual distance of our hotel to another restaurant for locals. Diagonally across the street is a bar. Hotel Miramar is close to the Pan American pier if you are leaving on a cruise. If you are active and don't mind hauling your luggage, you could possibly even walk to the pier from there. The interchanges are a bit confusing around the hotel though. I think I would stay at a beach resort next time to enjoy the water/beach. However, the staff at Miramar was excellent and friendly and they even let us check out as late as 3pm. We hung out on the rooftop prior to checking out, it was a partly cloudy day and not too hot. We found the contenental breakfast to be quite adequate. They had milk, cereal and many pastries. All in all, a great place to stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Why all the negative reviews, this is a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Duckdoger
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel for two nights after a holiday cruise. I just don't know where these terrible ratings are coming from. Hotel staff couldn't be friendler or more helpful, fast internet, and respectible rooms. No this is not a new place, but if you have ever traveled Europe and stayed in smaller, family operated hotels, this is very nice. Has all of the amenities one could want. Yes, the building is dated and not in a "hip" area but bus transportation right outside the front entrance and was only a 5 minute ride from the cruise ship pier. The roof top deck has great views too, laundry available and vending machines that don't charge 3x the going rate. That being said this isn't a perfect hotel. The rooms have seen too many coats of paint, water pressure is low but all of the fixtures are clean, the carpet new, A/C VERY quite. Avoid rooms ending in 01 or 02 as they face a busy street. Beds also a bit tired but still comfortable and the lines were cleaner than on my cruise ship. Sizzler, Subway, Papa Johns, and Wendy's all within walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: SteveDELIWEAR
Reviews.Content: Clean room in hotel that came with package. Continental breakfast though free, not worth it. No real places nearby to get breakfast. Bus ride into Old San Juan attractions. Friendly staff, excellent restaurant, Bistro 606, attached. Several dinners were had there. Leisurely service, well prepared and fresh food and moderately priced, though not cheap. Would not stay here again due to location, but for those looking for a modestly priced hotel, that is clean and well maintained, this is a viable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: Greggarious66
Reviews.Content: Stayed there after our cruise and would absolutely do so again. It was a great value for the price. Extremely large spotless room, recently updated with beautifully tiled bath. Front desk staff was fantastic, even during an onslaught of incoming/outgoing cruise passengers. The only thing lacking was a pool. Quiet, convenient location and the largely residential neighbourhood had some beautiful homes.

Reviews.Title: “needs updating”
Reviews.Author: antiquelover20
Reviews.Content: went on a cruise 12/12/10 so stayed the 11th at the hotel. NO coffee in the rooms and no pool- didn't mind not having a pool but feel coffee is a must and no room service before 8AM- we rise at 6AM so this was not good. Roof top is nice but the rooms need updating. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasTraveler073
Reviews.Content: My twelve year old daughter and I stayed at the Miramar for one evening before our cruise. We had a very large room, and the beds were great. We thought the location was great -- close to old San Juan, and still easy to get to the cruise terminal. The customer service was good -- the folks at the desk were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was an adequate continental, nothing special, but it was free. On the whole we thought it was a great hotel for the money, and I have booked it again before our cruise in two weeks.

Reviews.Title: “This was ideal..”
Reviews.Author: stoph
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Miramar was a bargain for what we paid - We would have expected to pay twice as much. It was clean and bright and very nice. The room was spacious. We stayed here the night before departing on a cruise. We got in very late, and were hungry. The staff helped us find a place to eat at one in the morning. The next morning it was very easy to get a cab and make our way to the cruise terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: professorj_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel the night before a cruise departure and give it my highest recommendation. Huge comfortable room, reasonable rates, and lovely staff. Juan Sanchez at the front desk could not have been nicer or more helpful. I misplaced the only sweater I had brought along somewhere in the hotel and had mentioned this to Mr. Sanchez when I checked out, heading for the cruise pier; he found my sweater and actually had it sent to me in my stateroom on board ship before it sailed! Thank you for this thoughtful effort, Mr. Sanchez!

Reviews.Title: “Very quaint”
Reviews.Author: victom
Reviews.Content: This hotel has Old San Juan charm and tons of customer service! The rooms are spacious but the beds are a little hard. Only one elevator so be ready to use the stairs after you get your luggage to your room. The roof top view is wonderful and we had a very relaxing time with our group of 10 just sitting and having beverages which were easily purchased at the grocery store 1/2 block away. The front desk was more than helpful with getting taxis and giving area information for the bus to Old San Juan just a mile away. Then it was just a 5 minute ride to the Royal Caribbean port which cost us about $5 a person for 5 of us with all our luggage. The breakfast is nothing to brag about and takes some time to get waited on but didn't bother us as we had plenty of time.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel with poor service and unexpected charges”
Reviews.Author: xdamethyst
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three days in Oct 2010 for vacation. Our stay was otherwise satisfactory, except for one episode which reflects very badly on the hotel’s attitude towards customer service. We were told that it had *free breakfast* every morning so in the next two days we took our breakfast at the hotel. The service was strange because they put drinks by window so you can help yourself, but food had to be served by the attendants there. They provided each customer two pieces of bread and two pieces of pastry, with a few pieces of watermelon. However, on the last day morning, when we were in a hurry to catch a ferry to the island Culebra, we asked the attendant to give us *one* share of bread and pastry so we could bring them with us and hit the road. But, this time, the attendant told us that the breakfast was actually a buffet, which meant we couldn’t take out any food. She consulted with a manager at the front desk and got the same answer. In the last two days when we had our breakfast, nobody told us it was a buffet so we could have as much as we wanted, now when we need only *one* share of food to go, suddenly they told us it was a buffet. The manager who talked to us had very poor attitude. Instead of empathizing with our situation, he asked us if we knew what a buffet was! Finally he relented and allowed the attendant to give us the food, but not before wasting much valuable time, which caused us to get stuck in traffic in San Juan and almost miss the ferry.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: pparrothead
Reviews.Content: When we first drove up to the Hotel Miramar my wife and I were taken aback. Could this be? But after parking our rental car, checking in and then going to our room we were more than satisfied. The hotel's staff was quite possibly the most polite, courteous, and helpful that we have ever encountered. The room was clean, comfortable and had a microwave and mini fridge. On the eighth floor was an outdoor rooftop terrace with a spectacular view of San Juan. In fact it was so nice we decided to have dinner up there one night with a chilled bottle of wine and dessert. We would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Jewel of a hotel centrally located, with easy access”
Reviews.Author: sfaamm
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, secluded yet very accessible hotel. Rooms are clean and spacious. Roof top terrace has great views of Condado area and beaches. Breakfast included was reasonable. Small but trendy restaurant with excellent dishes (try mussels with chorizo). Staff is friendly and courteous. Book through internet service like Expedia for best deals. The only major drawback was hot water did not work well for shower. Parking is a slight challenge, so rent a small car and leave the keys with the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “The roof top view was absolutely breathe taking....”
Reviews.Author: REM57
Reviews.Content: I decided to bring my daughther to San Juan for a week long vacation... after endless searching on the internet to find the perfect hotel.... we decided on the Miramar and what an amazing experience it has turned out to be. Sometimes you never know what to expect when booking online... but from the very moment we step in the door of the hotel... we felt like we were home away from home. We were greeted by Manuel Medalla the hotel representative and he was extremely welcoming and helpful. He took the time to assist we all of our questions & even took the time to give a quick run down of the city and best beaches. The rooms are spacious, clean, comfortable and affordable. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a weekend on the island.”
Reviews.Author: psicher
Reviews.Content: My wife got a really good fare on tickets to Puerto Rico for us and our 2 year old daughter so we decided to jump on it. Tired of the big chains we decided to go with this family run hotel after a good friend recommended it after she spent her honeymoon there. For being a small hotel, it had all that we needed. The rooms were clean and spacious, the staff was attentive and the free continental breakfast was a great way to start the morning. The dinner service at the restaurant was great, but so were the recommendations of nearby places. Speaking of places to go, the hotel is within walking distance of the brand new convention center and a few minutes walk from the Condado area. Old San Juan is only a short cab ride away, although I am sure you avid walkers could get there on foot (not us, no 2 year old is doing that any time soon!) Top to bottom this hotel was what we wanted and more. The attention of the staff was outstanding and the rooms were spacious and comfortable and the rate was outstanding. The owner, Juan, was very attentive to our needs and he could always be seen interacting with guests and trying to ensure they would have a great experience. More than one person we talked to at the hotel said it was not their first time staying there, a very important factor to consider. People like coming back, and we plan on doing it.

Reviews.Title: “The best small hotel I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: maridiu
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is very clean, walking distance to the Convention center, nice friendly people, fine restaurant and the beds a very confortable, together with the good price you can't ask for more. The BEST

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Can't wait to visit PR and stay at HOTEL MIRAMAR!”
Reviews.Author: unkie1969
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hotel Miramar in June 2010. Rooms are clean and serviced with a smile everyday. The hotel is located close to all points of interest, which made it easy to take a cab anywhere. The staff went above and beyond to make us feel at home. We are excited to return to the Hotel Miramar in 2011 for our annual family vacation!

Reviews.Title: “muggy room! poor sleep! rooms need to be renovated!”
Reviews.Author: silvia60763
Reviews.Content: I never sleep worse in my life. The room was smelling like old and muggy carpet. The beds are so uncomfortable. I never go back!!!!! customer service was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sevilla2010
Reviews.Content: There was a group of nine of us who spent 4 nights here over the 4th of July weekend. The hotel was great. Rooms were big and clean. The rooms in the front of the hotel have great views, the smaller rooms in the back have windows that look out to the building next door. All rooms are bright and get great sunlight. Rooms have fridge and microwave and internet access. No noise from traffic or other rooms. Theres a nice outdoor terrace on the roof. Was a nice place for our large group to just hang out together, without having to be in someones room. Parking was not a problem at all. There are a few spaces right out front, and more along the sides and back. Easy to get to major roads, easy to get to Old San Juan from the hotel. Breakfast is included. It's not much, muffins, danishes, and bread, enough to hold you over until lunch. Everyone at the desk was very nice and helpful. Would definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Engaged in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: NewlyEngaged630
Reviews.Content: My first experience with Hotel Miramar was an email, I had reached out to the hotel in regards to the local tours offered and received a reply within hours. Sylvia is amazing, not only she did reserve an amazing tour for us, but upgraded us, and gave us great insight on getting around in San Juan. She is a stellar employee and they are lucky to have her. This is an unforgetable trip for us because it was my boyfriend's 30th birthday but we also got engaged and Sylvia made it that much more special.

Reviews.Title: “good location, perfect room”
Reviews.Author: NordicTropical
Reviews.Content: I had a Caribbean tour with my friend, so we stayed almost every night another hotel...this was our last, and it was a great finish. The hotel is close to airport, but also not far from center. The staff is friendly, there was some mess with our reservation, but Fabian was nice and didnt let us waiting senseless long. The room is good qualitiy, clean, has everything that u need...and the bed is awsome huge :) A good example when price and quality meets.

Reviews.Title: “A humble and service oriented organization.”
Reviews.Author: RPacheco56
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a glamour place, however, the friendly staff and the cozy environment makes up for it. The location is great and allows the visitor to travel to historic and entertainment areas with ease. The staff provides a tremendous amount of information for tours and the best way to get around in San Juan and the rest of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed one night before our cruise”
Reviews.Author: chillthenrelax
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for one night Apr 10, 2010. Went with a group of 18, family wedding on the cruise. The taxi fare is determined at the airport. I think it was around $3-$4/person, $1/luggage. Rooms were big and clean. Beds were comfortable. They had a microwave, fridge, tv. The room size varies. The rooms ending with 1 and 2 are the biggest/best (e.g. 201, 202). Those rooms also have the best view, a lot of daylight gets in. My room was facing the wall of the next building. The tv size also varies. My friend's room had the smallest tv! it was probably 13-15 inch haha. Ours was ~30 inch. If I remember correctly room 202 had the big flat screen tv. Hotel has an elevator, but it's very slow. It's faster if you just take the stairs. The hotel has 7 floors. The roof has a couple of patio sets, very nice view. We brought drinks to the roof and hung out there all night. Gym is very tiny, you need a key from the front desk to get in. AC very good, very strong. windows do not have screens, but I don't remember any mosquitos, maybe it's because we're so close to the water, constant breeze. Ice machine in hallway. Two computers on the main floor with internet service (free). Internet connection for your laptop also free. I used their printer and they didn't charge me for the paper. There's a big supermarket down the street (one minute walk). They sell alcohol in the supermarket. A few places to eat. There's one place across the street and down a bit from the hotel with this wicked dish. Can't remember the name of the restaurant, but it looks like a bar/foodcourt, they have a jukebox in there. Can't remember the name of the dish (spanish name), but the dish has chicken&veggies in a tomatoey sauce on top of fried plantains. Oh my god it was delicious! We had it for lunch and dinner! Their papaya shake is also good. If you take a 15 minute walk, you'll reach a stretch of hotels lining the bay. They have a casino there, and also a noodle soup place! There are no nightclubs by the hotel, so it's pretty quiet at night. Breakfast is free, it's located in the tiny restaurant in the hotel lobby. Not that much variety though; pastries, fruit, cookies, coffee, tea, juice. For guests leaving for the cruise, they can check out 2pm. We decided to check out 11:30am and head to the cruise port. A lot of people were already there lining up to get on the ship. So it's not too early if you're wondering. I highly recommend this hotel, especially for people that will be hoping on the Royal Caribbean cruise ships. Also Princess cruise ships were at that port too. There are two cruise ports/terminals, one is at Old San Juan, and one is on the other side of the bay; Pan American Pier. Royal Caribbean uses Pan American Pier. This hotel is not for you if you want historic architecture, fancy shops and nightclubs. There were none of that around us.

Reviews.Title: “Good place - Bad parking”
Reviews.Author: confam
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, Dont plan on having a parking space but they will take care of your car. Nice complementary breakfast. Should have fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jaw0808
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Puerto Rico and the Hotel Miramar! I had a fabulous time! The hotel was nice and clean, the room was a nice size and the microwave and fridge were great. The beds were hard but I like it that way. There was a hair dryer in the bathroom and an iron and ironing board. The complementary breakfast was enough but if you wanted more the omelets was very good for about $6. The sun deck had just the right amount of breeze! The staff was the best. They took care of our every need from allowing us to check in early, late check out, helping us with tours and directions, suggestions from where to eat and what to do. They welcomed us “home” when ever we saw them. It felt like we were friends and they cared about us! If I find myself in Puerto Rico again I hope Sylvia, Samuel and the rest of the Hotel Miramar staff will be there to greet me when I get there!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but better ones exist”
Reviews.Author: Elvenfair
Reviews.Content: Definitely in an out-of-the-way place, but the taxi from the airport took us straight there without getting lost ($15 for 2 people + $1/bag + $1 for being after 10pm). We arrived late but the friendly front desk clerk directed us to Los Pinos café is not even two blocks away and serves good food at reasonable prices. (Try the “fried riped plantains” — looks and tastes a little like banana, with a texture something like French fries.) The hotel room was plenty large, with lots of drawers to use, a closet, a fridge and a microwave. The bathroom was not big enough for two at once unless one was in the shower. :) Everything was acceptably clean, albeit not new, but then, this isn’t a resort hotel. Unfortunately, the room is wide, rather than deep. In most hotels you walk in and the bathroom and the closet come first, then the main area — separates you from hallway noise a little bit. Here, you walk directly into the main area, with the bathroom and closet off to the left. Hence you can hear every sound in the hallway, every door slam, ever conversation in the hall, every husband pounding on the door to get the attention of the wife who’s in the bathroom… No street noise, though. :) The bed is hard as a rock and so are the pillows (though I happen to like hard pillows). The neighbors behind our heads were tossing and turning at occasional intervals throughout the night, not that I can blame them, but it caused a squeaking sound in our room for some reason, so that kept us awake too.
