The continental breakfast defines minimal — some small pastries, white toast, fruit (which was gone by the last half hour when we got down there), and supposedly cereal upon request. We paid $170 (including the exorbitant 20% tax on all San Juan hotels), and found out that someone else got the Caribe Hilton for $90 for the same night through Priceline. That’s a last-minute deal you can’t count on, but all things considered I’d have rather had a softer bed and guaranteed sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic front desk, great value”
Reviews.Author: supersew
Reviews.Content: The front desk, Juan and his assistant were so warm and wonderful to everyone. They really made us feel welcome and were helpful in every way. The building is quaint and just right for a smaller hotel. There is a grocery store a block away and a few little cafes with very good food. The hotel offers a nice breakfast with the room in a nice dining area. There is a nice quite computer room with a lovely lounge arera. Also, there is a sun deck and laundry machines available. The room had a microwave and refrigerator. Very clean room and hotel. You can ride the local bus into Old San Juan for just .75. There is a small beach across from the hotel. We would definitely stay there again and recommend it to our friends. Thank you, Juan, for taking your time with all of your guests. :~)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Miramar was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: greattrip42
Reviews.Content: This is just a wonderful place to stay. You can get to any destination easily either on the bus or by taxi. We did not rent a car so we traveled by bus the whole time we were there for .50 cents a ride. We arrived at the Hotel early but were still able to check in and were also given all the information we needed to direct us to all the great places we could want to visit. The staff was fantastic and so friendly and gracious. The room was great and very comfortable and clean. Continental breakfast was very good and more than I needed in the morning. During my stay there I had a personal crisis and the staff there attended to me with the most wonderful kindness and caring. I will come back again and again and suggest you try it too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to use before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: nanshoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights before cruise and staff was great with directions, nice little bar and restaurant on site. No pool but just 10 minutes in cab from Old San Juan and close to airport and pier. Quiet, clean and a great price per night. Great restaurant called La Casita - make right out of hotel then next right - up the street on left side at end of the block --opens at 6 each night. Authentic food and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: rosjest
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Miramar for one night during the weekend. We ended up arriving in San Juan much earlier in the day than anticipated and absolutely exhausted, so we decided to stop by the hotel and see if there was any chance of checking in early. It was about 8 in the morning, and I'm sure that Sylvia, the wonderful woman at the front desk, was very surprised to see us showing up that early to find out about checking in. Although the normal check-in time is much later, she was a great help and was able to get one of the rooms cleaned for us right away when the housekeeping staff came in. We were checked into a room and able to crash within an hour, and words can't express how grateful we were to her. In addition to the very caring and helpful staff, the hotel itself is quite nice. The rooms are large, clean, and nicely furnished. While the complimentary breakfast is not extensive, you can request for cereal, toast, etc. in addition to the fruit and pastries that they have available. There is also a small workout room on the top floor with the basic necessary equipment. The hotel is very conveniently located for heading into Old San Juan, the bus stop is directly across the street. Depending on the bus route, it's about 50 or 75 cents a person. We were sad we couldn't stay another night, and will definitely be back the next time we are in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised by quality personal service and accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: jjhukill
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Miramar March 14, 2010. It was a quality stay, all things considered. Located just on the mainland, it is a short 10 minute cab ride from the center of Old San Juan. The room was clean, quiet, and large enough for our party of four to hang out in during the day. The price was very competitive compared to other hotels nearby. The staff was helpful and accommodated our request for an early check-in. The man behind the counter even walked down the block to find a taxi for us upon check-out. Friendly staff, clean and roomy accommodations, competitive price..you really can't beat it. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: Trinketlady
Reviews.Content: What a great place. Rooms were very clean and roomy. There was a workout room and a laundry room! It is walking distance from the beach and the Condado resort area. The employees are very friendly and helpful. They really make you feel at home. The rooftop deck has great views. Great little local restaurants across the street. The bus stop is right there and takes you right to Old San Juan. We will definitely be going back

Reviews.Title: “Personal service in a friendly hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Buffalo_NYMeesha
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week's stay at the Miramar. Our room was wonderful with a micro and refrig that we used alot. I requested a quiet room and it was perfect. It is indeed easy to get to Old San Juan from here via bus. Sylvia and her staff were most friendly and helpful and PERSONAL. It was not the feeling of a big resort. A car is needed for most other sites(rainforest, ferry, etc.) and Sylvia helped us get one when their availability was tight. The neighboorhood seemed safe and the proximity to a grocery store was helpful. I can't say enough about the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: travelerSt_Croix
Reviews.Content: Located about 5 minutes from Old SanJuan by bus, this hotel is located in the center of some of the highest rated restaurants in San Juan. The bus cost is just $.50/person each way, or $1.00/day /person. A great deal for convenience and ease of travel! We covered the Old San Juan area from El Moro to Ben and Jerry's from the free trolley which picked us up at the bus station, a nice way to orient oneself to the area before setting out on foot! . This was a perfect getaway for a long weekend. The inhouse restaurant is the best value and quality in the area, it is called 606.

Reviews.Title: “older hotel, but nice, watch how much you pay”
Reviews.Author: BobAshevillenc
Reviews.Content: In doing my planing for the trip I always check the reviews and several sites for price. This hotel was $30 more on some sites. I just wanted a place so I could get to know San Juan not a resort. This hotel has some charm, clean, and the sevice very good. No pool, and the beach is a 15 min walk. But the rooms are large with a refig and microwave and a flat screen TV. They have a free continental breakfast and internet in all rooms. The staff was great told you where the bus stop ( right across the street) was and tips on where to go. There is a grocery store 1 block away and some places to eat . They have a roof top sun deck which is grat at night.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate until the very end”
Reviews.Author: coffeespoons8
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty basic hotel. It's clean, does not smell bad, and the rooms have the basic amenities anyone would need: hair dryer, iron, ironing board, security safe, and most importantly, air-conditioning! The room we stayed in (7th floor) had a decent enough bathroom. My one complaint with regard to the bathroom is that the hot water would run out at the end of my shower (and I don't take very long showers). So if you're someone who does take long showers, be prepared to be a little cold toward the end. The rest of the hotel is not bad, either. The rooftop deck is actually quite nice and affords a great view of the city. The breeze up there is heavenly. Also, there is a little restaurant/bistro bar right when you walk into the hotel - this is where they serve the continental breakfast and then later some cocktails and food. We did not really try out the breakdast and only had some coffee and juice one morning, but it looked like it consisted mainly of some fruit, pastries, coffee and juice. The hotel does have a pared down version of room service. We did not try this out, either - really, if you are in San Juan, there are much better places to eat other than your hotel, no matter where you stay. I do have to mention that the location of this hotel is ideal to getting into Old San Juan - there is a bus stop right across the street that only costs $0.75 and takes you right into OSJ. Doesn't get much more convenient than that. Keep in mind that taxis in this city are a bit on the pricy side. As for the staff, they were generally friendly and helpful, particularly the housekeeping staff. However, I have to mention an incredibly uncomfortable incident that overshadowed everything good that I just said about this place. The morning that we were checking out, one of the male front desk employees (I don't know if he was the manager or not) was incredibly rude to a female guest and her husband. I really can't say I know what had transpired before my boyfriend and I got downstairs, but all I know is that we inadvertently found ourselves in the middle of a screamfest of epic proportions. First, the rude hotel guy berated another employee in front of the guests - a HUGE no-no. Then, he said something to the lady about her bill. Granted, the lady was not the most polite of persons, but her response to his inquiry really was not that rude and did not necessitate his outrageous reaction - all he did was escalate the situation. He literally yelled at her to "SHUT UP!" about three times, and obviously the woman was becoming more agitated as well and responded in kind. This went on for a few minutes - yelling...no, screaming back and forth - until this guy tells this woman and her husband that he did not need their money and that he wanted them out of his hotel and that he was going to call the police. He also told them a few times that "this is NOT the United States! This is Puerto Rico!" and kept yelling at the woman, "WHO DO YOU THINK YOU ARE!?" He literally kicked them out of the hotel - my boyfriend and I walked to a nearby supermarket to get some change for the bus, and when we walked back to the bus stop, the couple was outside on the curb, in front of the hotel. The whole thing was unlike anything I'd ever witnessed before and honestly, was one of the most uncomfortable experiences I've ever had while traveling. The hotel guy, no matter WHAT the woman was doing or had said, should never have reacted the way that he did or said the things he said (in the volume in which he said them). In the hospitality industry (I know because my father has been in the hospitality industry for almost thirty years), there is simply NO EXCUSE WHATSOEVER for this type of rudeness and behavior. It is baffling to me that this man had the gall to treat a customer - any customer - in such a way. IN FRONT OF OTHER CUSTOMERS. Simply inexcusable. This hotel may be adequate in every other way, but someone get this man to an anger management class or in another industry pronto. He should know that word gets around. In short - don't stay here. For any reason.

Reviews.Title: “Very GoodValue”
Reviews.Author: looncalls
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel that is reasonably priced, has very good service, and the rooms are comfortable and clean, this is a very good choice. There is a small bar and restaurant on site and the food and drinks are excellent. There is a great new restaurant around the corner called "La Casita." We were only in San Juan 3 nights before our cruise but wound up eating there twice. It was recommended by the hotel desk clerk. The 8th floor rooftop has tables for outdoor cocktails (bring your own up to the roof) with a very pleasant view toward Condado and the ocean. You do have to walk up stairs from the 7th floor to get to it, however. It's a 75 cent ten minute bus ride to Old San Juan from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: praise_5
Reviews.Content: We went to Puerto to catch a Carnival Cruise.This was a pretty decent hotel considering some of the others we had seen. The room I had requested was 2 queen beds but we only got one king, and with 3 children two had to sleep on the floor. The room was really clean but was outdated. The hotel staff were really nice and helpful and the continental breakfast was pretty good. The only problem was the location,there were hardly any resturants around and it was far from the airport and the cruise port. We had to take a bus to go downtown and a Taxi to go to the cruise port and they were scary. We had a crazy guy trying to tell us to get on the wrong bus, I think he was going to lead us to a bad part of town and jump us, luckily I asked the bus driver to tell us the right way. Everyone drive crazy there!! I can't say I would every go back to Puerto Rico, it wasn't a pleasant experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at a pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nic-Sweden
Reviews.Content: We were stay two days at Miramar before cruising with RCCL. We arrived in the evening and we were from the beginning well taken care of. The room was quite big, clean and the standard was ok. The location was very good, about 15-20 min from the airport and about 10 min to the port. The are a very nice supermarket very close to the hotel that you shop whatever you want.The bus stopped right outside and there were taxis waiting to. What I think is great is that all the fares with taxis are already set so there is no confusion what it costs. We paid US 15 from the airport and 1USD a bag, and I think 1-2USD because we travelled in the evening. At the pier it cost about 12 USD. The breakfast is the thing that I think could have been better. Im not really used to this breakfast which was included like pastries, toast, jams etc and if you wanted something else you have to pay for it. We were hungry within 1 hour, so we have to buy something outside. I really recommend to visit Plaza Las Americas, the largest shopping mall in the Caribbean with 3 floors. A lot of stores, restaurants etc. Just a trip with taxi 12 USD. Don´t miss that! To summarize; Nice stay for this price, very good location and the breakfast could have been little better

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly service, clean, and on the bus route to Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: jilly-0
Reviews.Content: Very friendly service, clean, and quick to Old San Juan on the bus.

Reviews.Title: “A good San Juan hotel, a reviewer who has stayed at 4 hotels in the area!”
Reviews.Author: Ange_from_cheshire
Reviews.Content: Attentive staff, clean throughout. We stayed in a nice, large room albeit with an outdated 1970s bathroom suite. Location is good for old san juan as you can get a bus from just outside the hotel and in just under 10 mins for 50-75 cents per person each way you can be at the port docks. However, be warned that taxis are expensive here and you will pay a minimum of 14 dollars to the hotel from old san juan (only a few miles, worst, very worst, 4 miles).

Reviews.Title: “We were happy here”
Reviews.Author: Starshark10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay. The room was nice and cool and just a $15 cab ride from Old San Juan. The bathrooms were a little outdated but overall we were happy with the location and value. We moved to this hotel from the Courtyard Marriott where our credit card got skimmed by the hotel staff so anything would be better than that!

Reviews.Title: “Do not even think about this one!!! u´ll be on the street!!!!”
Reviews.Author: v_chau_001
Reviews.Content: A total og 9 friends, we make reservations for 5 rooms with same credit card, we arrived at different times and for the last 2 couples they just throw them to the street. They even lie about the credit card not beein ok with out having an explication on how come the other 3 rooms worked ok with same reservation and same credit card!!!! The guy at the front desk had no decision or problem solving skills, he just said we are full, they sugested a near by hotel, but this Hotel could not even pay for the TAXI, wichi is 15us for a 5k ride!!!! They do not even have any way to contact the manager who left the place before 4pm!!!! Its the worst hotel I been at and Puertoricans have no sence of customer service or problem solving!!!! evrything they see is how to get your US caring less for anything else. My recomendation travel to Mayan RIVERA, they know how to treat turist and the sites way better than here!!! we are Canadians and hopfuly we do not get back EVER to this joke of hotel call MARIMAR at San Juan puertorico..... finally the hotel looks like no body spend a cent in maintenance for the last 5 years, the hotels at Cuba are even better than this one!!!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Visit!”
Reviews.Author: dhstas
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant accommodations, large bright clean room. Delightful, friendly, and helpful staff (Sylvia was particularly pleasant and helpful). Property is very well maintained by a very dedicated staff. We couldn't have been more pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the location”
Reviews.Author: Sueedgington
Reviews.Content: Our room was large, clean, comfortable, and met our needs just fine. We wanted a reasonable place to stay that was close to Isla Grande Airport, shopping and restaurants. The owner and staff were very friendly and helpful. There is a large grocery store nearby and we had taxi drivers waiting without having to call. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Juan and his Staff - Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: CaribPilot
Reviews.Content: My name is Erick M, and I'm a new pilot to the Caribbean, and will be traveling to many different locations on a regular basis. My hotel experience in San Juan was with Juan and his staff at Hotel Miramar. I had a wonderful evening, as the rooms, the lobby downstairs, and the friendliness of the staff is better than any hotel I have experienced. Their breakfast of fruit, breads, and cereals in the morning is great, and the dinner menu/bar prices aren't bad at all if you are looking to dine in at the hotel for an evening. I'm sure that I will, as a pilot, have to return to San Juan on a number of occasions, and if I do, I will always have the request from my clients to stay at Hotel Miramar. Cheers to Juan and his great group of staff members for such a lovely hotel. See you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Horror”
Reviews.Author: pharmadine
Reviews.Content: My parents, sister and me stayed at this hotel last weekend and our experience was awful. First of all, for a hotel that is nothing close to a five star rating the rooms were way too expensive. We had one room for all four of us and it was certainly not great. We were charged for the four of us being in there and spent almost $360 for two nights. If it were up to me we would not have stayed there but my mother has been staying there for years and she is set in her ways. I checked and we could have stayed at Coral by the Sea, Comfort Inn, Coqui Inn or Howard Johnson for less than this. The price really bothered me but I decided to chill out and accomodate my family. Next, the room smelled moldy. Rooms should have proper ventilation and smell fresh. They advertised complimentary breakfast which we were told we could have and this was nothing much really and the gymn they advertised was a run down room with poorventilation on the 8th floor. Barey any of the equipment worked. Sunday morning wasthehighlight of the trip. We decided to pack a barrel and we were told by a receptionist that the barrel came and we could pack it. We were never told that we should have packed it downstairs so we took it to our room and packed it there.Sunday morning while my father and I were transporting the barrel downstairs, the hotel manager came screaming at us in an insulting manner and said we were damaging his new carpet and we should have used logic to realise we are not supposed to bring the barrel upstairs. Had we known this information first hand we would not have brought the barrel upstairs and none of the staff said anything about this to us. The annoying thing was the fact that the so called manager was insulting us and telling us we should have used logic i.e we are stupid. My father and I let him have it right on spot. I told him he was stupid and he has no right speaking to us in that tone. I also told him that we would never stay at his hotel again. As for the carpet, I asked him if it looked anywhere close to damaged. We used the smooth part of the barrel to turn it and if we saw a problem we would have asked for help. The manager was told that we would never stay at his hotel again and he replied "good"which means he has no remorse or shame for his stupid behavior. His behavior reflected poor judgment, poor managerial skills, poor customer serviceand overall stupidity and he was told this by my father and me. If youy are paying your money especially over $350 for two nights good service and high quality is expected all around. This hotel had none of that and is not on my list of recommendations. When I went back to work today I spoke with one of my colleagues and she said she didn't like that hotel. I wish she had told me sooner. I don't knowhow this hotel received a reward but the manager needs to go ASAP. Even though they spent money to upgrade it over the past few years they still have far to go to become a five star. I was so angry on Sunday that I was close to bursting. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: DaveLongBeach_CA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel the night before our cruise departure and again the night after arriving back in San Juan. A totally pleasant experience, and we are recommeding this hotel to all of our friends who will be visiting San Juan. This Hotel is quiet, the staff is pleasant and the rooms are fantastic for the price. We are looking forwarding to staying here on our next cruise from San Juan in 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean room with very friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: sci_biz_traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Miramar because it was the least expensive one that was closest to the Puerto Rico Convention Center. The room was equipped with a queen size bed, night stands, desk, chair, microwave, refirg., combination safe, big closet, lg screen TV in a dresser, and free WiFi. The bathroom was small but spotless. This is not the most modern hotel but the staff was incredibly helpful and friendly and every one of them greeted all the guest with a smile and a "Hello". A continental breakfast of juice, toast, rolls, coffee, and pastry was included. Again, not the most modern but was incredibly clean. This is a great deal for a nice room compared to other in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further, this is the hotel”
Reviews.Author: utilaguy
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms for two nights on our way to a wedding. We were perfectly happy with our stay....staff was GREAT, especially Sylvia. Clean rooms, parking for our rental car, good breakfast, good location for sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff old hotel sloooowwwww elevator”
Reviews.Author: figment7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Miramar for one night before a cruise. My extended family had about 7 rooms booked. The hotel is in a nice area with a grocery store less than a block away where you can get any items you may need. The room was nice size with a nice flat screen TV but the bathroom is where the updating needs to be done. The bathrooms were small and also quite a few of the rooms shower did not drain resulting in your standing in a pool of water at the end of the shower. After my wife showered it took over 30 minutes for the shower to drain and I ended up using my parents room to shower since their drain didn't clog. The elevator is very slow and very old. The maximum people you can put on the elevator is 4 and it takes forever to serve the entire hotel and is overwhelmed. The breakfast was a joke, evidentally they had a large group show up the day before a day early (60 people). Well that day they ran out of food and warned us, instead of I guess buying more food the following day to not repeat the same problem the next day it happened again. I went down at 8:10 (breakfast opens at 8am) and there was 1 muffin left on the muffin tray. Overall great staff just an old hotel in need of some changes that would make it a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: roby2000
Reviews.Content: Nice large room, spotless. Everthing was new. Not too close to everything and only a few parking places. But valet parking is provided free. Has fridge, micro and wifi. Staff was very nice and the $5 margaritas were awesome. No need to take the car to Old San Juan, bus across the street for 50 cents. Nice Continental b'fast with some real good miniature pastries. No view, but a nice room to be in. Also had a safe to keep the netbook in.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten track and somewhat rundown”
Reviews.Author: LSS33
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind not being anywhere near the beach, and being in a scary neighborhood; then this is the place for you. For the moderate cost, it's pretty clean but offers no amenities. The rooftop sundeck has nowhere to even rinse yourself off while sweating in the sun. The continental breakfast was totally disgusting; better off skipping it. Would never return to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: Busygeorgiafam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had to travel for one week to PR to take care of some family issues and pick up some things we'd left since we moved to the states. From the moment we walked in we were greeted with big smile by Sylvia who was great. We were very happy with our room as well and the fact that because the hotel is small, there's more personal attention. All the staff was great and friendly especially Miguel who went out of his way to even drop off a package for us at the post office. The sun deck had a great view and would've been great for tanning, if we'd had the time. It was quiet but yet very accessible to all of the centric areas for night life. The only thing we would've wanted was more variety for the continental breakfast but the breakfast we did pay for was great. My husband and I both agree we will be there again for our next getaway and even plan on taking the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Hadicap”
Reviews.Author: jungleboy0123
Reviews.Content: I want to thank Jose for helping me to get around and meeting my needs. Where there was a possibility that I was going to have a difficult stay because of my Handicap, Jose made it possible for to make my stay a remember one. What ever I needed he was there to prvide what was needed to make my stay comfortable. Thank You Jose! Hotel Miramar-San Juan 606 Ponce De Leon Ave. 10:29pm

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KmbrClen
Reviews.Content: My stay in Puerto Rico would not have been the same if we had not stayed at the Hotel Miramar and met Jose (the front desk clerk). He went above and beyond the call of duty. He helped us to rent a car, told of some of the best places to visit while in San Juan and the surrounding area, good places to eat and some of the night life. Our stay would not have been the same without Jose and his love of the job and the island.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: yugogirlr
Reviews.Content: my stay at the Miramar,with the exception of the bed,was great. All the staff was friendly and helpful. Bus stop across the street and just a 10 minute ride to Old San Juan. The negative was an extremly hard bed and an over priced restaurant. Never saw anyone in the restaurant except for free breakfast. Should change the concept.

Reviews.Title: “Greattttt hotel and staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: AnitaAruba
Reviews.Content: I arrive Sept. 10th till Sept. 15th, my experience with this is hotel is great and they have a very nice staff: Omar/Osvaldo/Silvia/Miguel and Jose. They made me feel home and welcomed me very much. A special thank to Jose: I like to thank you so much for your help and all good information that you've gave me, you were so nice to me and helpfull, you took all your time to listen and explain me everything. I felt so compfortable with you, you are a great friend Jose, and I will miss you for sure. Because of all of you, I will come back to your hotel. I had also a great time in PR. it's a nice Island, people are so friendly. I have enjoyed my stay very much in PR. and Hotel Miramar. Love you all and thank you!!! Nita. (Aruba).

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back”
Reviews.Author: Thetravelpair
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a waste of money. Old rooms, dirty towels, misplacing reservations. This place took forever to find. There are only 3 parking spaces available, there are many drunk homeless people as soon as you step out of the hotel, and the continental breakfast was consist of cereal, bread, and juice.

Reviews.Title: “the Miramar”
Reviews.Author: travelapple
Reviews.Content: our experience was great at the Miramar, 2 adults 1 teenager we had a top floor room that was large enough for us all not to fell cramped! the staff was helpful and firendly. we did walk over to the Conado beach area without problems, but for Old San Juan take the bus or rent a car ( we did both with no problem ) All in all we had a pleasant stay at the hotel and love Puerto Rico! Nice back lobby with birds and Internet if you dont have your own computer with you.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, helpful staff...hotel was average.”
Reviews.Author: mapesae
Reviews.Content: The hotel was decent. It was clean, friendly staff, offered a continental breakfast. There were several restaurants and a grocery store in the immediate area, and the bus stop is right across the street to get to Old San Juan ($.50.) If you take a cab it's $14 for a 3 minute ride. The hotel was clean, decent decor, had a restaurant, rooftop area, business center and a fitness center. I think the cost could be a little lower for what it offers, but I would recommend it to people who are trying to stick to a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: BrisMac
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights before boarding a cruise ship. The room was large, clean and quite. It had a fridge, but did not have coffee/tea making facilities. All the staff, in particular Sylvia, were extremly friendly and more than happy to assist with any enquire. There is no need for a car if staying in the city, as public transport is regular and cheap. There is a bus stop across the road from the hotel and a supermarket one block away. A great location for sightseeing as it is a short trip by bus to the Old Town. Once in the Old Town, there is a free bus service that takes you around the town and to the Fort. It's a hop-on-hop-off service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: prairieflowerCanada
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews on Trip Advisor about this hotel we booked and were not disappointed. Hotel staff were great, even giving tips on nearby grocery store. The breakfast is very continental but sufficient for getting the day started and then if you wish more you can always order from the menu. The hotel is old and therefore has been renovated so does not have the shiny look of the Hilton however the ambience is great for the area. A taxi to the cruise port is only about $20.00 and also to the airport. There is a small area for parking behind the hotel but it is free. We went to the grocery store and purchased a chicken and some pita bread and were able to pack a lunch for the 7 hr flight back to the states which made the flight a lot more enjoyable, not having to purchase less than fresh $7.00 sandwiches and stale snacks. If you want internet, you need to ask the front desk to hook you up. There is a fitness/pool on the 5th floor which we did not use but is available.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED THE HOTEL MIRAMAR, GREAT PLACE, STAFF, FOOD & SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Magnolia10
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the beach when we make our trips to San Juan. This trip, we decided to stay off the beach and closer to our meetings. We weren't sure what to expect, but... WOW ... Hotel Miramar was a wonderful surprise. From check in to check out, the staff was warm and helpful. The room and hotel were spotless and the food in the restaurant and room service was great! It ended up costing us about a third of what we usually pay when we stay on the beach. Keep up the great work, we are coming back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: plostaunau
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at the Miramar Hotel, it was very close to everything , walking distance and we were able to take a bus from hotel to Isla Verde, very unexpensive way to do it now. Then we were able to go to a great peruvian restaurant "Lima" next to the hotel. The service at the hotel was great and I really enjoy all the people. I would stay again with them

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Yoli18
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised to receive the kind of service I had at the Miramar Hotel. The rooms are very big and very clean,. I got wireless for free, and I was able to do a little bit of work while enjoying the nightlife in San Juan at a very moderate price. Dinner was very good and affordable for me.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place To Stay In Puerto Rico - Where service counts!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TroySly
Reviews.Content: When I arrived I was greeted and helped out in a timely manner!!!! I never thought the employees would help me find so much hope in the city!!!! This was my first time ever on the Island!!!! When I Checked In I was Greeted By Madiam!!!! She was the life of my stay at the hotel!!!! She makes a mean cup of coffee!!!! Jessie was the graveyard shift!!!! She helped plan my evenings out after hours!!!! And when you didnt think you met alot of great employees, you have Araceli sneeking back behind the counter --- (when she was off) to help out in the office and she's great!!!! Christain was the topping of the cake!!!! All I can say is WOOF 2 him!!!!! If you think people can look great and help u out with your vacation ----- this is the definate spot to come too!!!!! Now also let me tell you about the Euro Bistro Bar & Grill ----- The Food Is Great & You Dont Have To Leave The Hotel To Eat A Great Meal!!!!!! Just believe me stay there at the hotel and have the time of your life!!!!!! Troy M W Sly

Reviews.Title: “I love the Hotel Miramar and Sylvia!”
Reviews.Author: pmonji
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Miramar for about 5 days and I was so pleased with our stay. Sylvia helped us everyday and every night find fun activities. Without her, we would have spent so much more money and would have been lost! The staff was so kind...we really couldn't have asked for a better vacation! Would go back immediately!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, great service,”
Reviews.Author: Avian44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for three days. It is an older building, but well maintained and with a pleasant ambiance and a nice ocean view from the terrace. The rates represented great value, and the Miramar location permitted very easy bus routing either to Old San Juan, or to Isla Verde (the best San Juan beaches). The staff were very friendly and accommodating; very willing to make schedule changes and provide useful information about how to see and dine in San Juan. We found it to be an excellent combination of comfort, convenience and economy and would certainly recommend it for those reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice if you want to stay in the city.”
Reviews.Author: theyoungfamily4
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay late and had trouble finding other hotel options in San Juan. Pleasantly surprised. Not a beach resort by any means but alright for in the middle of the city. We were able to take the bus into old Jan Suan city to walk and see the sights. The hotel desk lady was very nice and accommodating even though we arrivbed late at night. The rooms were fairly spacious and clean. The hotel is next to an abondonded building but we felt safe even walking at night. There is also a 24 dinner across the street which is nice if you arrive late or depart early. We have friends who have an infant and were checking in at the same time. They had not menitoned the baby earlier but the front desk lady quickly left her desk and set up the crib and bedding (happily). Dont' stay at this hotel for a week. But passing through San Juan for a night or two nights to explore the city you will find it workable and convienent. Do not stay here if you are expecting a resort or beach front hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WELCOMING AT ALLLLLL!!!!! THe worse hotel Manager EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: resse123
Reviews.Content: I've read the reviews before the trip and I'm reading on my return. The Hotel is in a horrible location, in the middle of two abondoned facilities, a church and a building. Looking out the window from the hotel is like looking at the end of the world. The hotel is clean, However it should be your absolute last resort to rest your head for a night. The staff seemed welcoming, after they did not locate the reservations we made a month ahead. But then the manager and his wife were horrible to myself as, friends, his staff in front of our faces, and gave the worse Puerto Rico introduction. I will never advise anyone to stay here. Please do your research. This is not a vacation hotel, it does not even have a pool???????? Myself and friends work hard every day, and came to vacation in PR to have a good time, and for the manager to look down on us, speak as if we meant nothing, and didn't deserve his accomidation was totally wrong!!!!!!! Please I am very sure this isn't the vacation hotel. Me and freinds left the next morning and stayed at the beautiful Embassy Suites, now that is a hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “If I had booked further in advance I would have chosen another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Budget_Traveler_007
Reviews.Content: Let me clarify, Miramar isn't a bad hotel. Not by any means. But it cost $150/night after taxes (Friday night) - and we waited far too late to book so most hotels near San Juan were full. The hotel was clean, the location is not bad (parking is tough, but doable). You have to drive to Old San Juan and Condado... but there are a few restaurants within walking distance if you are just there for the night. The management was helpful enough and the room was okay (elevators really small and beds not that comfy.... but okay). Overall I'd say if you have no other choice you'd be fine here - but I'd opt for another hotel were I to go back. PS - the "breakfast" is a joke. It was bread and fruit and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE of extra charges!”
Reviews.Author: tiffstulips
Reviews.Content: BEWARE of Hotel Miramar! Just back from 2/14 sailing on Serenade. Made reservations with Hotel Miramar on Ponce de Leon Avenue in San Juan about 3 months ago. We wanted to spend an extra day in San Juan before going on our cruise so the kids could see the town. Hotel reservations were made through an online booking company. During the online search I entered 2 adults and 3 children and their ages. It selects hotels avaliable for the criteria you enter. I booked Hotel Miramar and paid a small booking fee. I called 1 week before arrival to confirm the reservation. I told them I was making sure we had 2 double beds since we were traveling with 3 children. They assured me that was correct. Upon arrival the girl at the counter says you have 5 people? I said yes. she said our rooms are 4 people max. After making several calls to the owner she informed us we would have to rent 2 rooms. (by the way, the rooms were huge and the 2 double beds would have easily accomidiated our family.) We argued we had confirmed and had a print out of the online reservation and they simply blamed the online booking company. We waited about 2 hours in the lobby while trying to work out something. Finally we reluctantly agreed to rent 2 rooms for 2 nights but at $99 for the 2nd room we were being forced to rent. We paid the $472 for the rooms as we were exhausted and ready to get settled. The next evening the front desk girl approached my husband in the lobby and told him she made a mistake and forgot to charge us the 2nd night at $99 for the 2nd room and we would have to pay it at check-out in the morning. She was very apologetic stating she was only doing her job and what the owner was relaying to her. The next morning the owners wife was at the desk. She was quite harsh stating we would need to pay the extra night. My husband argued he had already paid above and beyond and it was not our fault the desk girl made a mistake. With a very bad taste in out mouth we paid the final $99 plus tax and informed her we would be posting this as a review with a warning for others. At the beginning of our vacation a hotel that should have cost us $322 ended up costing almost $600 and alot of stress! We also stayed at 2 other hotels over the vacation on Houston and Chicago and had no problem renting 1 room.

Reviews.Title: “A SLEEPER and DIAMOND in the Ruff.”
Reviews.Author: PSRIC
Reviews.Content: Much to my surprise, this hotel was MUCH more than I had expected, considering I booked it as a part of a package DEAL. First of all, the staff couldnt have been nicer and more helpful. From the moment we arrived til the day of departure they knew our names and what room we were in and many of our interests. They knew all this because they took the time and interest to ASK. KUDOS to the "manager" SYLVIA...She constantly strove to make our stay one of excellence and confort. This is more of a "boutique" type hotel considering the number of rooms. The rooms were clean and kept tidy. The location is not all that bad and considering it is right on two main bus lines that go to Old San Juan, about 10 minutes bus ride...far eaisier than trying to drive and find parking in the touristy area. It is walking distance to another touristy area called the Condado, where more of the upscale hotels seem to be that were right on the beach. You have to check this one out for yourself. I would go back again and again. They treat you like family. ONE THING THOUGH...parking as in most other places in San Juan is at a minimum. The staff does try to accomodate parking with free on-street valet parking. The hotel itself has only I believe 5 parking spaces for guests. We did have a car for only a couple of days so it wasnt a major inconvenience. Thats pretty much it...I give it a thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “what a messy noisy place very difficult to find”
Reviews.Author: wakas
Reviews.Content: We took about 2 hrs looking for this hotel and its in a dingy side of town! In the process of getting lost we found ourselves in Old town, in cruise traffic and endless construction tunnels and bridges! finally from the parking lot of the hilton across the lagoon we see it lost in some other buildings! not what you see on the adverts! the young lady on duty at the front desk was very friendly but the older one either the manager or the owner was no rude and had no time really to attend to you. we got a room 201 which was so noisy the traffic the ac machine and we were moved to a smaller queiter 208. with a child we needed a microwave and had to practicaly move it for our selves! both rooms were clean and the showers too but the air was so stale the fan had to be on all the time! we spent 4 nights here but i would not return, i have stayed in better places for much less than what we paid for. and not forgetting the horrible continental breakfast, however the chef/attendant was so kind and helpful he made eating that junk fun he was from new york his english was great! in short was a terrible welcome to puerto rico i will return but not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “the best personal”
Reviews.Author: SpiderPeru
Reviews.Content: The hotel is goog, the place is average of the city, but the personal of services is better that others. especially melissa, who is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Hotel Miramar staff!”
Reviews.Author: laindiah
Reviews.Content: just a thank you note for all the staff @ miramar hotel . my husband and i hade an emergency trip to pr and booked whith hotels.com from 08/29/08 till 09/01/08 .our room was 507 . liliana make sure we where conftable at all times. the custumer service that its offered in this hotel "miramar" its greatt! rated # 1.not enough parking.,but... when i couldn't park. the person @ the desk will take my keys and park my car for me. i felt secure there are cops out there in the street making sure that the turist are safe! once again thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Miramar,s BLUFF”
Reviews.Author: Floridatravelor08
Reviews.Content: We booked with Hotwire and stayed for 8days. first thing no parking area ,very small ,best to park out in the street.even thou it didn,t feel safe.Room was o.k. have been in better. Didn,t like beeing in a 6th floor, elevator was to small kinda scary. breakfast go to MCDonalds. staff not to friendly. I still think i got overcharged. hotel was not worth it. would i recommend it NO I Don,t think so. No pool--and no view-- could have done better.

Reviews.Title: “It was decent”
Reviews.Author: KandyKane056
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal with Expedia airplane and hotel. I checked the reviews and it seemed OK. We couldn't complain the hotel room was spotless clean. Yes, it is old, i didn't smell any mold though but I noticed the carpet and the comforter were worn out. I liked the fact that we had a microwave and a mini fridge that we stock w drinks. Our cleaning lady was super nice, she always left our room clean, bring us fresh towels and ask us if we needed help. Same with reception. I could have pass on the breakfast though, the food not that good. It is continental breakfast, cereal and fruit and after a couple of days I was tired of it. To go to the beach or to Ashford St you have to walk like 10 min, not bad, a lot of people ( even locals) are walking out at night and we saw cops too. However you have to pass under a dark bridge though. Next time, I would choose a hotel in Isla Verde, the beach is WAY nicer than Condado.

Reviews.Title: “There are a lot better places to stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: LolaGirl
Reviews.Content: The rooms smelled awful. The curtains smelled like urine and mold, and the carpets were dirty. Through the windows you could look into the dilapidated building next door. We checked in around 8pm and asked if there was a place we could get a bite to eat, and the desk staff told us there was a Subway up the street a few blocks. We walked up and "experienced" the local homeless sleeping in their boxes, and a few shady types lurking in doorways. There is nothing to do at or very near the hotel. For a bite to eat, go the Los Pinos Cafe, about a block from the hotel. It's a local cafe where you can get red beans and rice and authentic Puerto Rican fare, and a local beer. The wait staff there is friendly and speaks multiple languages. You can go up on the roof and look at the neighboring buildings falling down and the endless construction cranes. Don't expect spectacular views of the ocean in its glory, or the mountains, either. The continental breakfast consisted of boxed doughnuts and canned pineapple, which were sitting out way too long. You could get a stale bagel for $2 from an uninterested woman who spent much time talking on her cell phone while purportedly cleaning up the breakfast area and helping the guests. You can walk to the beach, about fifteen minutes away. It is tiny, and across from the police station (that should make you feel safe..). You walk through the park where the homeless live, and it smells of urine and general filth. You can also walk through the tent city, where the protesters are set up to try to stop what they determine to be illegal construction. Seems that most of the beachfront has been bought up by chain hotels, and the buildings go right up to the water, and the tall buildings stop the ocean breezes from coming into the city, so the whole area is hot and stagnant. There must be a lot of places to stay in San Juan that are much more pleasant. The one nice thing was that the hotel desk staff were very nice. They hailed us a cab so we could get back to the airport and it was there is just a few minutes. They speak very good English.

Reviews.Title: “The worse Hotel in earth!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lollypop23
Reviews.Content: This was the worse hotel I have stayed in. Starting with bed bugs, old and deteriorated bathrooms, the hallways and room had a weird smell. My friends and I wish we had Lysol. One of my friends even sprayed one of my perfumes. Top of all were the rude staff and manager or owner (Juan). Instead of admitting that his staff made a mistake; he treated all of us like criminals by making threats to call the police. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Everyone in Puerto Rico was very friendly except for the people in this horrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hair in the Tub”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Queen12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Miramar in March 2008 before we left on a cruise. I viewed some of the Trip Advisor photos and there must be a difference between the "Hotel Miramar" and "The Courtyard Miramar" because the photos of the Courtyard looked much nicer than where we stayed. Overall, our stay was pleasant. This hotel is in a dangerous part of town so do not venture out alone at night. This is an old hotel, but kept up well. My main and only complaint would be that there was a lot of hair in the shower (and I mean a lot- 10 or more pieces) and there was hair in the bathroom sink. The blanket on the bed was also very old and worn looking-- I would not touch it. This is a 3 star hotel... so once again you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Miramar Fine For Short Visit”
Reviews.Author: iam_intrigued
Reviews.Content: Considering the prices of five star hotels, we decided to try this hotel for a couple of nights before going to the El San Juan Hotel & Casino. It was clean, the rooms were large, and the staff was helpful. The artwork on the walls in the rooms was actually nice, and the room included a fridge & microwave. Continental breakfast was included which came with fruit, cold cuts, cheese, cereal, coffee, rolls, etc. For two breakfasts, it was nice. They had pretty plants in the tiny lobby and a few birds and a computer in a room behind the lobby. The restaurant next door is where the breakfast was served. We also had dinner there our first night (it included a free drink) - it was pretty good. For a lower-end priced hotel, this one was fine. The only negative was that the area wasn't close to much. We took the bus to Old San Juan, which was good, and we walked down the block through a few souvenir shops. Other than that, you're in the middle of no where. If you need to hang out in your room, it doesn't have the right feel to want to stay and relax. It just didn't feel that safe. (They locked their front door at night and had someone let you in). For a short stay, it's acceptable. The hotel itself had some charm. If you want to be in the heart of everything, though, this location leaves something to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: gln126
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked for a night after our cruise. We paid $13 from the Pan American Pier to the hotel. We arrived at 10:30 in the morning. They said that the rooms would not be available until 3 p.m. They allowed us to leave our luggages there while we explored old San Juan. There was a local bus stop located across the street on the left of the hotel. All you have to pay was $0.50/person. It took us to the main station in Old San Juan. We came back at 4:15 thinking that the room should be ready. However, they said that it wouldn't be ready in another half hour. There was not much to do around the hotel so we walked to the supermarket on the right of the hotel. We came back at 5 but the room was still not ready. The receptionist said that we have to pay an extra $3 per person and $5 per night stay. I said that I already paid all the taxes and others charges when I booked for ONE night stay. She then pointed to a sign on the top of the counter and said that the travel agency might not know about these additional charges. I looked at it and it said that the charges commenced on October 1, 2006. And now it is 2008!She insisted that we pay before we she gave us the key. I paid and I asked for a receipt and she printed one for me. The room was big but the fridge didn't work, The chair almost fell apart. The lamp was barely attached to the light fixture. There was mildew smell in the room too unless you blast up the A.C.. When we checked out the next morning, an old man asked us to pay AGAIN because he couldn't find it on the computer nor it was checked off that we paid. It was too much of a hassel to stay in this hotel. Anyway, the taxi fee to the airport was $15.

Reviews.Title: “Our one night stay.”
Reviews.Author: Bollan
Reviews.Content: We arrived the hotel late on january 19th. An elderly man meet us, checked us in, and pointed out the elevator for us. We stayed on the 4.th floor, to the left out of the elevator, and in the last room on the left side of the hallway. A large room with two large beds, a small fridge, tv, a comfortable chair, and a bathroom. We have nothing to complain about regarding the room, and we slept well in the beds. The aircondition were a little bit noisy, but did not ruin our nights sleep. We went down a couple of floors and found the ice machine. I am glad we did not have a room there. It made a lot of noise. Also fount a soda machine there. Did not have breakfast there, but walked to Wahlgreens a couple of blocks away to get some soda and water for our upcomming cruise. Checked out just before 12, and a nice man at the desk rang for a taxi to pick us up. Overall not the best hotel we have stayed on, but most certainly not the worst. We could easily stay here another time, just for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel for long vacations”
Reviews.Author: Oslo81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Miramar for just one night. It is not a hotel where I would stay longer. The location is not great. It is not close to any of the sights. You have to take a taxi to the old city and the best beaches. The room was ok. It was big and very peaceful. But the breakfast was awful. We got to the restaurant half an hour before the breakfast ended and it was no food left and the woman working there would not bring out more food.

Reviews.Title: “Concrete Block”
Reviews.Author: hysterian
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in this hotel because it was concrete inside and out. I have never stayed in a room with concrete walls, and hope never to again! The staff was nice, but the hotel is on the fringe of a very bad neighborhood and we would not have felt comfortable walking. I had thought the hotel was very close to Old San Juan from their website, but it is about a $12 cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Run now while you can”
Reviews.Author: ebbtide123
Reviews.Content: Thought that by picking a cheap hotel I could save a lot. Not this one. Except for a couple of staff, I've never seen rudeness so institutionalized in one place from the owner down to the support staff. The rooms are old and worn. Bathrooms are scarily decrepit with tiles chipped off. Thanks god, there is the outside and that's what I did when I was booked in this rodent's nest- stayed outside most of the time expect when it's time to sleep......and you better be really exhausted...

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: imagineone
Reviews.Content: My mother and I took a mother-daughter vacation and stayed at the Miramar for a week. It was a wonderful place to stay! The hotel was beautiful and the staff, especially Ramon, Sylvia, and Jorge (and others that I can't remember their names) were very accommodating and helpful! They gave us directions, recommendations on places to eat, and wanted to hear of our adventures daily! I loved the area that it was in as I wanted to see more of authentic Puerto Rico than the Americanized version that I felt I would've gotten at the Hilton, etc. There's a pharmacy across the street with some very reasonable souvenirs. Los Pinos Cafe, also across the street, had some wonderful Mofongo. The hotel had a very nice continental breakfast and since parking is so hard to find in San Juan the private parking was a lifesaver! The sundeck has a beautiful view! Overall, I wouldn't have wanted to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “You could not pay me to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: diver4life
Reviews.Content: Paid a very low rate, as they say you get what you pay for. The hotel manager, very rude and full of himself. We arrived at 4:00pm was given the room, took the luggage to the room, opened the door, the room was not cleaned from the prior guest, I did state we arrived at 4:00pm!!!! I returned to the front desk, the young lady was apologetic and gave us a new room, she even went up and checked the room before we lugged or luggage back up to the quest rooms. The room was ok, but the ice machine is not inside a stair well or a room on its own, it is in the hallway of the quest floor, all night you can here the ice machine dropping ice into the bottom of the machines' holding area. The first shower I took, I tried to adjust the shower head and it came off in my hand, the next morning I gave the shower head to the manager, as he gave it to his maintenance person the manager rolled his eyes and asked me was their anything else broken in the room . I replied not at this time. Later that day when we return from the beach, I tried to adjust the air conditioners fan speed, but could not because that was broken. The maid service starts at 7:00am sharp, we know because the wheels on the maid service cart squeal load enough to wake you up, if that doesn't wake you the maids talking loudly, and their buckets hitting the wall, cart, ice machine, doors, will. I could continue but you get the point. I haven't had the opportunity to go to Europe yet, but if this is a European style hotel, no thanks, I'll pass.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience Do Not Go, Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: westerngypsy
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review about the Hotel Miramar, 606 Ponce de Leon Avenue, San Juan. Please DO NOT confuse this with the Marriot Miramar. I made a reservation through Priceline and received confirmation for the Hotel Miramar for one night prior to our cruise leaving. We arrived at the hotel at 1:30 am. Upon arrival a woman comes out to the street (this hotel is located on a dark side street in San Juan) and asks us if we have reservations. I thought it most peculiar, but said yes, we have reservations and confirmation (room already paid for) through Priceline. I then give her the paper with confirmation # and payment record, and she says, "We don't have a reservation for you" I said, " Here it is, it's already paid for". She says "no, I have no room for you." I said, "OK, just give us a room and we will pay for it." (thinking that I will sort all this out when we get home) She then says, "there are no rooms available here, they are all taken." So we get back into the taxi, and our driver feels so sorry for us that he starts to call other hotels to see if he can get us a room. Meantime, we are sitting in front of the Miramar when another taxi pulls up. Two people get out and go in with their travel packet and yep.....sure enough they get a room! Meantime the taxi driver is having a difficult time since all hotel rooms are booked up in San Juan. Finally he calls the Best Western who just had an airline crew cancellation! We go there and I am telling the from desk clerk about our experirence with the Miramar Hotel and he said there were two other people who checked in earlier that the same thing had happened to. The Hotel Miramar was unsympathetic, and totally unresponsive. I would tell everyone out there, don't go.....it was an awful experience for 2 very experienced travelers. I have contacted Priceline for them to resolve this... Stay clear of this place, you don't want to end up like we did.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dario_Rossy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good we stayed there from 26 April till 01 May 2007. We had a blast the hotel staff is excellent, clean room and towels everyday. The hotel is near a supermarket on the right and right on the corner you can find taxi, and if you want to go by bus it's only 0,75$. Naxt to Pueblo Supermarket you can find, subway, a chinese restaurant, a restaurant about taco's and there's a pharmacy across the street and a beauty saloon. So we found the hotel very good. In the lobby there's free internet for 30 minutes. And a cute yellow bird. And I forgot to take a picture of the bathroom next time :-)

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience at the Hotel Miramar”
Reviews.Author: MissKareBear
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Miramar with my family prior to our Caribbean cruise. Thankfully, we were there for only 1 night. It is by far the worst experience at a hotel that I have ever encountered. We requested one room for a family of 4 and were given “the biggest room”. Granted, the room is relatively spacious, but none of us felt comfortable at all to really get good sleep. For starters, we found hairs on the bed sheets, as well as stains on the bed covers. Because I tend to get cold at night, I reluctantly still pulled the covers over me. As I started to fluff the comforter I started to smell this…odor. When I took a sniff I realize the odor came from the stained, dirty, and now stinky comforter. Needless to say, I just opened my suitcase and grabbed a sweater and slept in it instead to keep warm. The toilet itself is so dirty and filled with grim that I wish there were toilet seat covers provided. The bathroom itself just gave us a really unclean sense of feeling and I felt showering in it might get me dirtier. In fact, all of us opt to forgo the shower, so we can leave this “hotel” as soon as possible and get on our cruise ship! Despite paying extra for the 2 additional people, breakfast was only provided for 2. I did not go for breakfast, but those that did, said it was mediocre at best and we all still went out somewhere else to grab a bit. The area around the hotel doesn’t necessary feel unsafe, but I surely will not stroll around there at night with my family. Over, this was a HUGE disappointment of a hotel. I would never ever stay at this hotel again, and will not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of four, one 16 year old, 12 year old and husband and I stayed at the Miriamar from May 8 through the 12. When we arrived we were tired and hot from the trip. We registered in and were told we had a room on the third floor. But guess what we had to walk up to our room and carry our luggage. Now if any one knows a women and a pre teen girl can bring a lot of luggage. So up we all went with all this stuff. Went into our room and to our supprise it was a room with a king. I did tell them we needed a room with double beds. Found the maid in the hall way and tried to explain to her we needed a bigger room, she spoke no english and my spanish is not the best. make a long story short we did get a room with two beds. We did notice the room did have a musty smell and the AC did not work well. The house cleaning was not at all good. The tub backed up and the maid never cleaned the bath room good. The tub had a ring around it and the beds were not made. The view from the top floor was great, you saw the water and the kids loved it. The breakfast was ok. The front desk staff were helpful and nice. Would we stay again, no. I would go somewere else.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel, clean, friendly and free continental breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mrchicago
Reviews.Content: Knew the hotel was old so there was no surprise. However, when we arrived the elevator was being renovated, which meant a walk up to our room on third floor, sun deck and gym on 7. Rooms are large and clean with small fridge and micro. The staff was extremely helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations. A free continental breakfast buffet was served every morning in the restaurant (currently only open for breakfast). Hilton hotel is a 10 minute walk, casino 15 minutes, 45 minute walk to Old San Juan. You can catch a bus in either direction in front of hotel for 75 cents. This is not a luxury hotel, no room service, pool or beach. However, if looking to save some money it's the place to stay. Keep in mind, your view could be a vacant building or car lot. We had a good time. Take a bus to Marriott if you want to sit by the pool. P.S. We got an extreme bargain on this hotel. If we had paid full price we may have been more critical.
